70       def test_binom(self):
71           n = np.array([0.264, 4, 5.2, 17])
72           k = np.array([2, 0.4, 7, 3.3])
73           nk = np.array(np.broadcast_arrays(n[:,None], k[None,:])
74                         ).reshape(2, -1).T
75           rknown = np.array([[-0.097152, 0.9263051596159367, 0.01858423645695389,
76               -0.007581020651518199],[6, 2.0214389119675666, 0, 2.9827344527963846],
77               [10.92, 2.22993515861399, -0.00585728, 10.468891352063146],
78               [136, 3.5252179590758828, 19448, 1024.5526916174495]])
79           assert_func_equal(cephes.binom, rknown.ravel(), nk, rtol=1e-13)
80   
81           # Test branches in implementation
82           rng = np.random.RandomState(1234)
83           n = np.r_[np.arange(-7, 30), 1000*rng.rand(30) - 500]
84           k = np.arange(0, 102)
85           nk = np.array(np.broadcast_arrays(n[:,None], k[None,:])
86                         ).reshape(2, -1).T
87   
88           assert_func_equal(cephes.binom,
89                             cephes.binom(nk[:,0], nk[:,1] * (1 + 1e-15)),
90                             nk,
91                             atol=1e-10, rtol=1e-10)
92   
93       def test_binom_2(self):
94           # Test branches in implementation
95           np.random.seed(1234)
96           n = np.r_[np.logspace(1, 300, 20)]
97           k = np.arange(0, 102)
98           nk = np.array(np.broadcast_arrays(n[:,None], k[None,:])
99                         ).reshape(2, -1).T
100  
101          assert_func_equal(cephes.binom,
102                            cephes.binom(nk[:,0], nk[:,1] * (1 + 1e-15)),
103                            nk,
104                            atol=1e-10, rtol=1e-10)
105  
106      def test_binom_exact(self):
107          @np.vectorize
108          def binom_int(n, k):
109              n = int(n)
110              k = int(k)
111              num = 1
112              den = 1
113              for i in range(1, k+1):
114                  num *= i + n - k
115                  den *= i
116              return float(num/den)
117  
118          np.random.seed(1234)
119          n = np.arange(1, 15)
120          k = np.arange(0, 15)
121          nk = np.array(np.broadcast_arrays(n[:,None], k[None,:])
122                        ).reshape(2, -1).T
123          nk = nk[nk[:,0] >= nk[:,1]]
124          assert_func_equal(cephes.binom,
125                            binom_int(nk[:,0], nk[:,1]),
126                            nk,
127                            atol=0, rtol=0)
128

139              (1014, 507, 4.39774063758732849e+303),
140              (1016, 508, 1.75736486108312519e+304),
141              (1018, 509, 7.02255427788423734e+304),
142              (1020, 510, 2.80626776829962255e+305),
143              (1022, 511, 1.12140876377061240e+306),

145              (1026, 513, 1.79075474304149900e+307),
146              (1028, 514, 7.15605105487789676e+307)
147          ]
148          dataset = np.asarray(dataset)
149          FuncData(cephes.binom, dataset, (0, 1), 2, rtol=1e-12).check()

202      def test_chndtr(self):
203          assert_equal(cephes.chndtr(0,1,0),0.0)
204  
205          # Each row holds (x, nu, lam, expected_value)
206          # These values were computed using Wolfram Alpha with
207          #     CDF[NoncentralChiSquareDistribution[nu, lam], x]
208          values = np.array([
209              [25.00, 20.0, 400, 4.1210655112396197139e-57],
210              [25.00, 8.00, 250, 2.3988026526832425878e-29],
211              [0.001, 8.00, 40., 5.3761806201366039084e-24],
212              [0.010, 8.00, 40., 5.45396231055999457039e-20],
213              [20.00, 2.00, 107, 1.39390743555819597802e-9],
214              [22.50, 2.00, 107, 7.11803307138105870671e-9],
215              [25.00, 2.00, 107, 3.11041244829864897313e-8],
216              [3.000, 2.00, 1.0, 0.62064365321954362734],
217              [350.0, 300., 10., 0.93880128006276407710],
218              [100.0, 13.5, 10., 0.99999999650104210949],
219              [700.0, 20.0, 400, 0.99999999925680650105],
220              [150.0, 13.5, 10., 0.99999999999999983046],
221              [160.0, 13.5, 10., 0.99999999999999999518],  # 1.0
222          ])
223          cdf = cephes.chndtr(values[:, 0], values[:, 1], values[:, 2])
224          assert_allclose(cdf, values[:, 3], rtol=1e-12)
225  
226          assert_almost_equal(cephes.chndtr(np.inf, np.inf, 0), 2.0)
227          assert_almost_equal(cephes.chndtr(2, 1, np.inf), 0.0)
228          assert_(np.isnan(cephes.chndtr(np.nan, 1, 2)))
229          assert_(np.isnan(cephes.chndtr(5, np.nan, 2)))
230          assert_(np.isnan(cephes.chndtr(5, 1, np.nan)))

254      def test_diric(self):
255          # Test behavior near multiples of 2pi.  Regression test for issue
256          # described in gh-4001.
257          n_odd = [1, 5, 25]
258          x = np.array(2*np.pi + 5e-5).astype(np.float32)
259          assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, n_odd), 1.0, decimal=7)
260          x = np.array(2*np.pi + 1e-9).astype(np.float64)
261          assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, n_odd), 1.0, decimal=15)
262          x = np.array(2*np.pi + 1e-15).astype(np.float64)
263          assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, n_odd), 1.0, decimal=15)
264          if hasattr(np, 'float128'):
265              # No float128 available in 32-bit numpy
266              x = np.array(2*np.pi + 1e-12).astype(np.float128)
267              assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, n_odd), 1.0, decimal=19)
268  
269          n_even = [2, 4, 24]
270          x = np.array(2*np.pi + 1e-9).astype(np.float64)
271          assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, n_even), -1.0, decimal=15)
272  
273          # Test at some values not near a multiple of pi
274          x = np.arange(0.2*np.pi, 1.0*np.pi, 0.2*np.pi)
275          octave_result = [0.872677996249965, 0.539344662916632,
276                           0.127322003750035, -0.206011329583298]
277          assert_almost_equal(special.diric(x, 3), octave_result, decimal=15)
278  
279      def test_diric_broadcasting(self):
280          x = np.arange(5)
281          n = np.array([1, 3, 7])
282          assert_(special.diric(x[:, np.newaxis], n).shape == (x.size, n.size))

315      def test_expm1(self):
316          assert_equal(cephes.expm1(0),0.0)
317          assert_equal(cephes.expm1(np.inf), np.inf)
318          assert_equal(cephes.expm1(-np.inf), -1)
319          assert_equal(cephes.expm1(np.nan), np.nan)
320  
321      def test_expm1_complex(self):
322          expm1 = cephes.expm1
323          assert_equal(expm1(0 + 0j), 0 + 0j)
324          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, 0)), complex(np.inf, 0))
325          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, 1)), complex(np.inf, np.inf))
326          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, 2)), complex(-np.inf, np.inf))
327          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, 4)), complex(-np.inf, -np.inf))
328          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, 5)), complex(np.inf, -np.inf))
329          assert_equal(expm1(complex(1, np.inf)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
330          assert_equal(expm1(complex(0, np.inf)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
331          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, np.inf)), complex(np.inf, np.nan))
332          assert_equal(expm1(complex(-np.inf, np.inf)), complex(-1, 0))
333          assert_equal(expm1(complex(-np.inf, np.nan)), complex(-1, 0))
334          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.inf, np.nan)), complex(np.inf, np.nan))
335          assert_equal(expm1(complex(0, np.nan)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
336          assert_equal(expm1(complex(1, np.nan)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
337          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.nan, 1)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
338          assert_equal(expm1(complex(np.nan, np.nan)), complex(np.nan, np.nan))
339  
340      @pytest.mark.xfail(reason='The real part of expm1(z) bad at these points')
341      def test_expm1_complex_hard(self):
342          # The real part of this function is difficult to evaluate when
343          # z.real = -log(cos(z.imag)).
344          y = np.array([0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 5, 11, 20])
345          x = -np.log(np.cos(y))
346          z = x + 1j*y
347  
348          # evaluate using mpmath.expm1 with dps=1000
349          expected = np.array([-5.5507901846769623e-17+0.10033467208545054j,
350                                2.4289354732893695e-18+0.20271003550867248j,
351                                4.5235500262585768e-17+0.30933624960962319j,
352                                7.8234305217489006e-17-3.3805150062465863j,
353                               -1.3685191953697676e-16-225.95084645419513j,
354                                8.7175620481291045e-17+2.2371609442247422j])
355          found = cephes.expm1(z)
356          # this passes.
357          assert_array_almost_equal_nulp(found.imag, expected.imag, 3)
358          # this fails.
359          assert_array_almost_equal_nulp(found.real, expected.real, 20)

367      def test_fdtrc(self):
368          assert_equal(cephes.fdtrc(1, 1, 0), 1.0)
369          # Computed using Wolfram Alpha:
370          #   1 - CDF[FRatioDistribution[2, 1/10], 1e10]
371          assert_allclose(cephes.fdtrc(2, 0.1, 1e10), 0.27223784621293512,
372                          rtol=1e-12)

374      def test_fdtri(self):
375          assert_allclose(cephes.fdtri(1, 1, [0.499, 0.501]),
376                          array([0.9937365, 1.00630298]), rtol=1e-6)
377          # From Wolfram Alpha:
378          #   CDF[FRatioDistribution[1/10, 1], 3] = 0.8756751669632105666874...
379          p = 0.8756751669632105666874
380          assert_allclose(cephes.fdtri(0.1, 1, p), 3, rtol=1e-12)

408          assert_array_equal(cephes.gammasgn(vals), reference)

559      def test_log1p(self):
560          log1p = cephes.log1p
561          assert_equal(log1p(0), 0.0)
562          assert_equal(log1p(-1), -np.inf)
563          assert_equal(log1p(-2), np.nan)
564          assert_equal(log1p(np.inf), np.inf)
565  
566      def test_log1p_complex(self):
567          log1p = cephes.log1p
568          c = complex
569          assert_equal(log1p(0 + 0j), 0 + 0j)
570          assert_equal(log1p(c(-1, 0)), c(-np.inf, 0))
571          with suppress_warnings() as sup:
572              sup.filter(RuntimeWarning, "invalid value encountered in multiply")
573              assert_allclose(log1p(c(1, np.inf)), c(np.inf, np.pi/2))
574              assert_equal(log1p(c(1, np.nan)), c(np.nan, np.nan))
575              assert_allclose(log1p(c(-np.inf, 1)), c(np.inf, np.pi))
576              assert_equal(log1p(c(np.inf, 1)), c(np.inf, 0))
577              assert_allclose(log1p(c(-np.inf, np.inf)), c(np.inf, 3*np.pi/4))
578              assert_allclose(log1p(c(np.inf, np.inf)), c(np.inf, np.pi/4))
579              assert_equal(log1p(c(np.inf, np.nan)), c(np.inf, np.nan))
580              assert_equal(log1p(c(-np.inf, np.nan)), c(np.inf, np.nan))
581              assert_equal(log1p(c(np.nan, np.inf)), c(np.inf, np.nan))
582              assert_equal(log1p(c(np.nan, 1)), c(np.nan, np.nan))
583              assert_equal(log1p(c(np.nan, np.nan)), c(np.nan, np.nan))

594      def test_mathieu_cem(self):
595          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_cem(1,0,0),(1.0,0.0))
596  
597          # Test AMS 20.2.27
598          @np.vectorize
599          def ce_smallq(m, q, z):
600              z *= np.pi/180
601              if m == 0:
602                  # + O(q^2)
603                  return 2**(-0.5) * (1 - .5*q*cos(2*z))
604              elif m == 1:
605                  # + O(q^2)
606                  return cos(z) - q/8 * cos(3*z)
607              elif m == 2:
608                  # + O(q^2)
609                  return cos(2*z) - q*(cos(4*z)/12 - 1/4)
610              else:
611                  # + O(q^2)
612                  return cos(m*z) - q*(cos((m+2)*z)/(4*(m+1)) - cos((m-2)*z)/(4*(m-1)))
613          m = np.arange(0, 100)
614          q = np.r_[0, np.logspace(-30, -9, 10)]
615          assert_allclose(cephes.mathieu_cem(m[:,None], q[None,:], 0.123)[0],
616                          ce_smallq(m[:,None], q[None,:], 0.123),
617                          rtol=1e-14, atol=0)
618  
619      def test_mathieu_sem(self):
620          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_sem(1,0,0),(0.0,1.0))
621  
622          # Test AMS 20.2.27
623          @np.vectorize
624          def se_smallq(m, q, z):
625              z *= np.pi/180
626              if m == 1:
627                  # + O(q^2)
628                  return sin(z) - q/8 * sin(3*z)
629              elif m == 2:
630                  # + O(q^2)
631                  return sin(2*z) - q*sin(4*z)/12
632              else:
633                  # + O(q^2)
634                  return sin(m*z) - q*(sin((m+2)*z)/(4*(m+1)) - sin((m-2)*z)/(4*(m-1)))
635          m = np.arange(1, 100)
636          q = np.r_[0, np.logspace(-30, -9, 10)]
637          assert_allclose(cephes.mathieu_sem(m[:,None], q[None,:], 0.123)[0],
638                          se_smallq(m[:,None], q[None,:], 0.123),
639                          rtol=1e-14, atol=0)
640  
641      def test_mathieu_modcem1(self):
642          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modcem1(1,0,0),(0.0,0.0))
643  
644      def test_mathieu_modcem2(self):
645          cephes.mathieu_modcem2(1,1,1)
646  
647          # Test reflection relation AMS 20.6.19
648          m = np.arange(0, 4)[:,None,None]
649          q = np.r_[np.logspace(-2, 2, 10)][None,:,None]
650          z = np.linspace(0, 1, 7)[None,None,:]
651  
652          y1 = cephes.mathieu_modcem2(m, q, -z)[0]
653  
654          fr = -cephes.mathieu_modcem2(m, q, 0)[0] / cephes.mathieu_modcem1(m, q, 0)[0]
655          y2 = (-cephes.mathieu_modcem2(m, q, z)[0]
656                - 2*fr*cephes.mathieu_modcem1(m, q, z)[0])
657  
658          assert_allclose(y1, y2, rtol=1e-10)
659  
660      def test_mathieu_modsem1(self):
661          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modsem1(1,0,0),(0.0,0.0))
662  
663      def test_mathieu_modsem2(self):
664          cephes.mathieu_modsem2(1,1,1)
665  
666          # Test reflection relation AMS 20.6.20
667          m = np.arange(1, 4)[:,None,None]
668          q = np.r_[np.logspace(-2, 2, 10)][None,:,None]
669          z = np.linspace(0, 1, 7)[None,None,:]
670  
671          y1 = cephes.mathieu_modsem2(m, q, -z)[0]
672          fr = cephes.mathieu_modsem2(m, q, 0)[1] / cephes.mathieu_modsem1(m, q, 0)[1]
673          y2 = (cephes.mathieu_modsem2(m, q, z)[0]
674                - 2*fr*cephes.mathieu_modsem1(m, q, z)[0])
675          assert_allclose(y1, y2, rtol=1e-10)
676  
677      def test_mathieu_overflow(self):
678          # Check that these return NaNs instead of causing a SEGV
679          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_cem(10000, 0, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
680          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_sem(10000, 0, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
681          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_cem(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
682          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_sem(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
683          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modcem1(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
684          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modsem1(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
685          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modcem2(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
686          assert_equal(cephes.mathieu_modsem2(10000, 1.5, 1.3), (np.nan, np.nan))
687  
688      def test_mathieu_ticket_1847(self):
689          # Regression test --- this call had some out-of-bounds access
690          # and could return nan occasionally
691          for k in range(60):
692              v = cephes.mathieu_modsem2(2, 100, -1)
693              # Values from ACM TOMS 804 (derivate by numerical differentiation)
694              assert_allclose(v[0], 0.1431742913063671074347, rtol=1e-10)
695              assert_allclose(v[1], 0.9017807375832909144719, rtol=1e-4)

1045         for n in range(2,4):
1046             b1[n] = b[n]*exp(-abs(real(2.0/3.0*0.01*sqrt(0.01))))
1047         assert_array_almost_equal(a,b1,6)

1089     @pytest.mark.fail_slow(5)
1090     def test_ai_zeros_big(self):
1091         z, zp, ai_zpx, aip_zx = special.ai_zeros(50000)
1092         ai_z, aip_z, _, _ = special.airy(z)
1093         ai_zp, aip_zp, _, _ = special.airy(zp)
1094 
1095         ai_envelope = 1/abs(z)**(1./4)
1096         aip_envelope = abs(zp)**(1./4)
1097 
1098         # Check values
1099         assert_allclose(ai_zpx, ai_zp, rtol=1e-10)
1100         assert_allclose(aip_zx, aip_z, rtol=1e-10)
1101 
1102         # Check they are zeros
1103         assert_allclose(ai_z/ai_envelope, 0, atol=1e-10, rtol=0)
1104         assert_allclose(aip_zp/aip_envelope, 0, atol=1e-10, rtol=0)
1105 
1106         # Check first zeros, DLMF 9.9.1
1107         assert_allclose(z[:6],
1108             [-2.3381074105, -4.0879494441, -5.5205598281,
1109              -6.7867080901, -7.9441335871, -9.0226508533], rtol=1e-10)
1110         assert_allclose(zp[:6],
1111             [-1.0187929716, -3.2481975822, -4.8200992112,
1112              -6.1633073556, -7.3721772550, -8.4884867340], rtol=1e-10)

1318 class TestBeta:
1319     """ 
1320     Test beta and betaln. 
1321     """
1322 
1323     def test_beta(self):
1324         assert_equal(special.beta(1, 1), 1.0)
1325         assert_allclose(special.beta(-100.3, 1e-200), special.gamma(1e-200))
1326         assert_allclose(special.beta(0.0342, 171), 24.070498359873497,
1327                         rtol=1e-13, atol=0)
1328 
1329         bet = special.beta(2, 4)
1330         betg = (special.gamma(2)*special.gamma(4))/special.gamma(6)
1331         assert_allclose(bet, betg, rtol=1e-13)
1332 
1333     def test_beta_inf(self):
1334         assert_(np.isinf(special.beta(-1, 2)))
1335 
1336     def test_betaln(self):
1337         assert_equal(special.betaln(1, 1), 0.0)
1338         assert_allclose(special.betaln(-100.3, 1e-200),
1339                         special.gammaln(1e-200))
1340         assert_allclose(special.betaln(0.0342, 170), 3.1811881124242447,
1341                         rtol=1e-14, atol=0)
1342 
1343         betln = special.betaln(2, 4)
1344         bet = log(abs(special.beta(2, 4)))
1345         assert_allclose(betln, bet, rtol=1e-13)

1348 class TestBetaInc:
1349     """ 
1350     Tests for betainc, betaincinv, betaincc, betainccinv. 
1351     """
1352 
1353     def test_a1_b1(self):
1354         # betainc(1, 1, x) is x.
1355         x = np.array([0, 0.25, 1])
1356         assert_equal(special.betainc(1, 1, x), x)
1357         assert_equal(special.betaincinv(1, 1, x), x)
1358         assert_equal(special.betaincc(1, 1, x), 1 - x)
1359         assert_equal(special.betainccinv(1, 1, x), 1 - x)
1360 
1361     # Nontrivial expected values computed with mpmath:
1362     #    from mpmath import mp
1363     #    mp.dps = 100
1364     #    p = mp.betainc(a, b, 0, x, regularized=True)
1365     #
1366     # or, e.g.,
1367     #
1368     #    p = 0.25
1369     #    a, b = 0.0342, 171
1370     #    x = mp.findroot(
1371     #        lambda t: mp.betainc(a, b, 0, t, regularized=True) - p,
1372     #        (8e-21, 9e-21),
1373     #        solver='anderson',
1374     #    )
1375     #
1376     @pytest.mark.parametrize(
1377         'a, b, x, p',
1378         [(2, 4, 0.3138101704556974, 0.5),
1379          (0.0342, 171.0, 1e-10, 0.552699169018070910641),
1380          # gh-3761:
1381          (0.0342, 171, 8.42313169354797e-21, 0.25),
1382          # gh-4244:
1383          (0.0002742794749792665, 289206.03125, 1.639984034231756e-56,
1384           0.9688708782196045),
1385          # gh-12796:
1386          (4, 99997, 0.0001947841578892121, 0.999995)])
1387     def test_betainc_betaincinv(self, a, b, x, p):
1388         p1 = special.betainc(a, b, x)
1389         assert_allclose(p1, p, rtol=1e-15)
1390         x1 = special.betaincinv(a, b, p)
1391         assert_allclose(x1, x, rtol=5e-13)
1392 
1393     # Expected values computed with mpmath:
1394     #     from mpmath import mp
1395     #     mp.dps = 100
1396     #     p = mp.betainc(a, b, x, 1, regularized=True)
1397     @pytest.mark.parametrize('a, b, x, p',
1398                              [(2.5, 3.0, 0.25, 0.833251953125),
1399                               (7.5, 13.25, 0.375, 0.43298734645560368593),
1400                               (0.125, 7.5, 0.425, 0.0006688257851314237),
1401                               (0.125, 18.0, 1e-6, 0.72982359145096327654),
1402                               (0.125, 18.0, 0.996, 7.2745875538380150586e-46),
1403                               (0.125, 24.0, 0.75, 3.70853404816862016966e-17),
1404                               (16.0, 0.75, 0.99999999975,
1405                                5.4408759277418629909e-07),
1406                               # gh-4677 (numbers from stackoverflow question):
1407                               (0.4211959643503401, 16939.046996018118,
1408                                0.000815296167195521, 1e-7)])
1409     def test_betaincc_betainccinv(self, a, b, x, p):
1410         p1 = special.betaincc(a, b, x)
1411         assert_allclose(p1, p, rtol=5e-15)
1412         x1 = special.betainccinv(a, b, p)
1413         assert_allclose(x1, x, rtol=8e-15)
1414 
1415     @pytest.mark.parametrize(
1416         'a, b, y, ref',
1417         [(14.208308325339239, 14.208308325339239, 7.703145458496392e-307,
1418           8.566004561846704e-23),
1419          (14.0, 14.5, 1e-280, 2.9343915006642424e-21),
1420          (3.5, 15.0, 4e-95, 1.3290751429289227e-28),
1421          (10.0, 1.25, 2e-234, 3.982659092143654e-24),
1422          (4.0, 99997.0, 5e-88, 3.309800566862242e-27)]
1423     )
1424     def test_betaincinv_tiny_y(self, a, b, y, ref):
1425         # Test with extremely small y values.  This test includes
1426         # a regression test for an issue in the boost code;
1427         # see https://github.com/boostorg/math/issues/961
1428         #
1429         # The reference values were computed with mpmath. For example,
1430         #
1431         #   from mpmath import mp
1432         #   mp.dps = 1000
1433         #   a = 14.208308325339239
1434         #   p = 7.703145458496392e-307
1435         #   x = mp.findroot(lambda t: mp.betainc(a, a, 0, t,
1436         #                                        regularized=True) - p,
1437         #                   x0=8.566e-23)
1438         #   print(float(x))
1439         #
1440         x = special.betaincinv(a, b, y)
1441         assert_allclose(x, ref, rtol=1e-14)
1442 
1443     @pytest.mark.parametrize('func', [special.betainc, special.betaincinv,
1444                                       special.betaincc, special.betainccinv])
1445     @pytest.mark.parametrize('args', [(-1.0, 2, 0.5), (0, 2, 0.5),
1446                                       (1.5, -2.0, 0.5), (1.5, 0, 0.5),
1447                                       (1.5, 2.0, -0.3), (1.5, 2.0, 1.1)])
1448     def test_betainc_domain_errors(self, func, args):
1449         with special.errstate(domain='raise'):
1450             with pytest.raises(special.SpecialFunctionError, match='domain'):
1451                 special.betainc(*args)
1452 
1453     @pytest.mark.parametrize('dtype', [np.float32, np.float64])
1454     def test_gh21426(self, dtype):
1455         # Test for gh-21426: betaincinv must not return NaN
1456         a = np.array([5.], dtype=dtype)
1457         x = np.array([0.5], dtype=dtype)
1458         result = special.betaincinv(a, a, x)
1459         assert_allclose(result, x, rtol=10 * np.finfo(dtype).eps)

1462 class TestCombinatorics:
1463     def test_comb(self):
1464         assert_allclose(special.comb([10, 10], [3, 4]), [120., 210.])
1465         assert_allclose(special.comb(10, 3), 120.)
1466         assert_equal(special.comb(10, 3, exact=True), 120)
1467         assert_equal(special.comb(10, 3, exact=True, repetition=True), 220)
1468 
1469         assert_allclose([special.comb(20, k, exact=True) for k in range(21)],
1470                         special.comb(20, list(range(21))), atol=1e-15)
1471 
1472         ii = np.iinfo(int).max + 1
1473         assert_equal(special.comb(ii, ii-1, exact=True), ii)
1474 
1475         expected = 100891344545564193334812497256
1476         assert special.comb(100, 50, exact=True) == expected
1477 
1478     def test_comb_with_np_int64(self):
1479         n = 70
1480         k = 30
1481         np_n = np.int64(n)
1482         np_k = np.int64(k)
1483         res_np = special.comb(np_n, np_k, exact=True)
1484         res_py = special.comb(n, k, exact=True)
1485         assert res_np == res_py
1486 
1487     def test_comb_zeros(self):
1488         assert_equal(special.comb(2, 3, exact=True), 0)
1489         assert_equal(special.comb(-1, 3, exact=True), 0)
1490         assert_equal(special.comb(2, -1, exact=True), 0)
1491         assert_equal(special.comb(2, -1, exact=False), 0)
1492         assert_allclose(special.comb([2, -1, 2, 10], [3, 3, -1, 3]), [0., 0., 0., 120.])
1493

1498             special.comb(3.4, 4, exact=True)

1509         assert_equal(special.perm(2, -1, exact=False), 0)

1512     @pytest.mark.thread_unsafe
1513     def test_perm_iv(self):
1514         # currently `exact=True` only support scalars
1515         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="scalar integers"):
1516             special.perm([1, 2], [4, 5], exact=True)
1517 
1518         # Non-integral scalars with N < k, or N,k < 0 used to return 0, this is now
1519         # deprecated and will raise an error in SciPy 1.16.0
1520         with pytest.deprecated_call(match="Non-integer"):
1521             special.perm(4.6, 6, exact=True)
1522         with pytest.deprecated_call(match="Non-integer"):
1523             special.perm(-4.6, 3, exact=True)
1524         with pytest.deprecated_call(match="Non-integer"):
1525             special.perm(4, -3.9, exact=True)
1526 
1527         # Non-integral scalars which aren't included in the cases above an raise an
1528         # error directly without deprecation as this code never worked
1529         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Non-integer"):
1530             special.perm(6.0, 4.6, exact=True)

1681     def test_ellipkinc_2(self):
1682         # Regression test for gh-3550
1683         # ellipkinc(phi, mbad) was NaN and mvals[2:6] were twice the correct value
1684         mbad = 0.68359375000000011
1685         phi = 0.9272952180016123
1686         m = np.nextafter(mbad, 0)
1687         mvals = []
1688         for j in range(10):
1689             mvals.append(m)
1690             m = np.nextafter(m, 1)
1691         f = special.ellipkinc(phi, mvals)
1692         assert_array_almost_equal_nulp(f, np.full_like(f, 1.0259330100195334), 1)
1693         # this bug also appears at phi + n * pi for at least small n
1694         f1 = special.ellipkinc(phi + pi, mvals)
1695         assert_array_almost_equal_nulp(f1, np.full_like(f1, 5.1296650500976675), 2)

1697     def test_ellipkinc_singular(self):
1698         # ellipkinc(phi, 1) has closed form and is finite only for phi in (-pi/2, pi/2)
1699         xlog = np.logspace(-300, -17, 25)
1700         xlin = np.linspace(1e-17, 0.1, 25)
1701         xlin2 = np.linspace(0.1, pi/2, 25, endpoint=False)
1702 
1703         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(xlog, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(xlog)),
1704                         rtol=1e14)
1705         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(xlin, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(xlin)),
1706                         rtol=1e14)
1707         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(xlin2, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(xlin2)),
1708                         rtol=1e14)
1709         assert_equal(special.ellipkinc(np.pi/2, 1), np.inf)
1710         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(-xlog, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(-xlog)),
1711                         rtol=1e14)
1712         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(-xlin, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(-xlin)),
1713                         rtol=1e14)
1714         assert_allclose(special.ellipkinc(-xlin2, 1), np.arcsinh(np.tan(-xlin2)),
1715                         rtol=1e14)
1716         assert_equal(special.ellipkinc(-np.pi/2, 1), np.inf)

1772 class TestEllipCarlson:
1773     """Test for Carlson elliptic integrals ellipr[cdfgj]. 
1774     The special values used in these tests can be found in Sec. 3 of Carlson 
1775     (1994), https://arxiv.org/abs/math/9409227 
1776     """
1777     def test_elliprc(self):
1778         assert_allclose(elliprc(1, 1), 1)
1779         assert elliprc(1, inf) == 0.0
1780         assert isnan(elliprc(1, 0))
1781         assert elliprc(1, complex(1, inf)) == 0.0
1782         args = array([[0.0, 0.25],
1783                       [2.25, 2.0],
1784                       [0.0, 1.0j],
1785                       [-1.0j, 1.0j],
1786                       [0.25, -2.0],
1787                       [1.0j, -1.0]])
1788         expected_results = array([np.pi,
1789                                   np.log(2.0),
1790                                   1.1107207345396 * (1.0-1.0j),
1791                                   1.2260849569072-0.34471136988768j,
1792                                   np.log(2.0) / 3.0,
1793                                   0.77778596920447+0.19832484993429j])
1794         for i, arr in enumerate(args):
1795             assert_allclose(elliprc(*arr), expected_results[i])
1796 
1797     def test_elliprd(self):
1798         assert_allclose(elliprd(1, 1, 1), 1)
1799         assert_allclose(elliprd(0, 2, 1) / 3.0, 0.59907011736779610371)
1800         assert elliprd(1, 1, inf) == 0.0
1801         assert np.isinf(elliprd(1, 1, 0))
1802         assert np.isinf(elliprd(1, 1, complex(0, 0)))
1803         assert np.isinf(elliprd(0, 1, complex(0, 0)))
1804         assert isnan(elliprd(1, 1, -np.finfo(np.float64).tiny / 2.0))
1805         assert isnan(elliprd(1, 1, complex(-1, 0)))
1806         args = array([[0.0, 2.0, 1.0],
1807                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0],
1808                       [1.0j, -1.0j, 2.0],
1809                       [0.0, 1.0j, -1.0j],
1810                       [0.0, -1.0+1.0j, 1.0j],
1811                       [-2.0-1.0j, -1.0j, -1.0+1.0j]])
1812         expected_results = array([1.7972103521034,
1813                                   0.16510527294261,
1814                                   0.65933854154220,
1815                                   1.2708196271910+2.7811120159521j,
1816                                   -1.8577235439239-0.96193450888839j,
1817                                   1.8249027393704-1.2218475784827j])
1818         for i, arr in enumerate(args):
1819             assert_allclose(elliprd(*arr), expected_results[i])
1820 
1821     def test_elliprf(self):
1822         assert_allclose(elliprf(1, 1, 1), 1)
1823         assert_allclose(elliprf(0, 1, 2), 1.31102877714605990523)
1824         assert elliprf(1, inf, 1) == 0.0
1825         assert np.isinf(elliprf(0, 1, 0))
1826         assert isnan(elliprf(1, 1, -1))
1827         assert elliprf(complex(inf), 0, 1) == 0.0
1828         assert isnan(elliprf(1, 1, complex(-inf, 1)))
1829         args = array([[1.0, 2.0, 0.0],
1830                       [1.0j, -1.0j, 0.0],
1831                       [0.5, 1.0, 0.0],
1832                       [-1.0+1.0j, 1.0j, 0.0],
1833                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0],
1834                       [1.0j, -1.0j, 2.0],
1835                       [-1.0+1.0j, 1.0j, 1.0-1.0j]])
1836         expected_results = array([1.3110287771461,
1837                                   1.8540746773014,
1838                                   1.8540746773014,
1839                                   0.79612586584234-1.2138566698365j,
1840                                   0.58408284167715,
1841                                   1.0441445654064,
1842                                   0.93912050218619-0.53296252018635j])
1843         for i, arr in enumerate(args):
1844             assert_allclose(elliprf(*arr), expected_results[i])
1845 
1846     def test_elliprg(self):
1847         assert_allclose(elliprg(1, 1, 1), 1)
1848         assert_allclose(elliprg(0, 0, 1), 0.5)
1849         assert_allclose(elliprg(0, 0, 0), 0)
1850         assert np.isinf(elliprg(1, inf, 1))
1851         assert np.isinf(elliprg(complex(inf), 1, 1))
1852         args = array([[0.0, 16.0, 16.0],
1853                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0],
1854                       [0.0, 1.0j, -1.0j],
1855                       [-1.0+1.0j, 1.0j, 0.0],
1856                       [-1.0j, -1.0+1.0j, 1.0j],
1857                       [0.0, 0.0796, 4.0]])
1858         expected_results = array([np.pi,
1859                                   1.7255030280692,
1860                                   0.42360654239699,
1861                                   0.44660591677018+0.70768352357515j,
1862                                   0.36023392184473+0.40348623401722j,
1863                                   1.0284758090288])
1864         for i, arr in enumerate(args):
1865             assert_allclose(elliprg(*arr), expected_results[i])
1866 
1867     def test_elliprj(self):
1868         assert_allclose(elliprj(1, 1, 1, 1), 1)
1869         assert elliprj(1, 1, inf, 1) == 0.0
1870         assert isnan(elliprj(1, 0, 0, 0))
1871         assert isnan(elliprj(-1, 1, 1, 1))
1872         assert elliprj(1, 1, 1, inf) == 0.0
1873         args = array([[0.0, 1.0, 2.0, 3.0],
1874                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0, 5.0],
1875                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0, -1.0+1.0j],
1876                       [1.0j, -1.0j, 0.0, 2.0],
1877                       [-1.0+1.0j, -1.0-1.0j, 1.0, 2.0],
1878                       [1.0j, -1.0j, 0.0, 1.0-1.0j],
1879                       [-1.0+1.0j, -1.0-1.0j, 1.0, -3.0+1.0j],
1880                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0, -0.5],    # Cauchy principal value
1881                       [2.0, 3.0, 4.0, -5.0]])   # Cauchy principal value
1882         expected_results = array([0.77688623778582,
1883                                   0.14297579667157,
1884                                   0.13613945827771-0.38207561624427j,
1885                                   1.6490011662711,
1886                                   0.94148358841220,
1887                                   1.8260115229009+1.2290661908643j,
1888                                   -0.61127970812028-1.0684038390007j,
1889                                   0.24723819703052,    # Cauchy principal value
1890                                   -0.12711230042964])  # Caucny principal value
1891         for i, arr in enumerate(args):
1892             assert_allclose(elliprj(*arr), expected_results[i])

1900                         8.63426920644241857617477551054e-6,

1910 class TestEllipLegendreCarlsonIdentities:
1911     """Test identities expressing the Legendre elliptic integrals in terms 
1912     of Carlson's symmetric integrals.  These identities can be found 
1913     in the DLMF https://dlmf.nist.gov/19.25#i . 
1914     """
1915 
1916     def setup_class(self):
1917         self.m_n1_1 = np.arange(-1., 1., 0.01)
1918         # For double, this is -(2**1024)
1919         self.max_neg = finfo(double).min
1920         # Lots of very negative numbers
1921         self.very_neg_m = -1. * 2.**arange(-1 +
1922                                            np.log2(-self.max_neg), 0.,
1923                                            -1.)
1924         self.ms_up_to_1 = np.concatenate(([self.max_neg],
1925                                           self.very_neg_m,
1926                                           self.m_n1_1))
1927 
1928     def test_k(self):
1929         """Test identity: 
1930         K(m) = R_F(0, 1-m, 1) 
1931         """
1932         m = self.ms_up_to_1
1933         assert_allclose(ellipk(m), elliprf(0., 1.-m, 1.))
1934 
1935     def test_km1(self):
1936         """Test identity: 
1937         K(m) = R_F(0, 1-m, 1) 
1938         But with the ellipkm1 function 
1939         """
1940         # For double, this is 2**-1022
1941         tiny = finfo(double).tiny
1942         # All these small powers of 2, up to 2**-1
1943         m1 = tiny * 2.**arange(0., -np.log2(tiny))
1944         assert_allclose(ellipkm1(m1), elliprf(0., m1, 1.))
1945 
1946     def test_e(self):
1947         """Test identity: 
1948         E(m) = 2*R_G(0, 1-k^2, 1) 
1949         """
1950         m = self.ms_up_to_1
1951         assert_allclose(ellipe(m), 2.*elliprg(0., 1.-m, 1.))
1952

1963                      2.24465928+2.61657514j,
1964                      2.83974105+3.17562810j,
1965                      3.33546074+3.64617438j,
1966                      3.76900557+4.06069723j])

1969     def _check_variant_func(self, func, other_func, rtol, atol=0):
1970         rng = np.random.RandomState(1234)
1971         n = 10000
1972         x = rng.pareto(0.02, n) * (2*rng.randint(0, 2, n) - 1)
1973         y = rng.pareto(0.02, n) * (2*rng.randint(0, 2, n) - 1)
1974         z = x + 1j*y
1975 
1976         with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
1977             w = other_func(z)
1978             w_real = other_func(x).real
1979 
1980             mask = np.isfinite(w)
1981             w = w[mask]
1982             z = z[mask]
1983 
1984             mask = np.isfinite(w_real)
1985             w_real = w_real[mask]
1986             x = x[mask]
1987 
1988             # test both real and complex variants
1989             assert_func_equal(func, w, z, rtol=rtol, atol=atol)
1990             assert_func_equal(func, w_real, x, rtol=rtol, atol=atol)
1991 
1992     def test_erfc_consistent(self):
1993         self._check_variant_func(
1994             cephes.erfc,
1995             lambda z: 1 - cephes.erf(z),
1996             rtol=1e-12,
1997             atol=1e-14  # <- the test function loses precision
1998             )
1999 
2000     def test_erfcx_consistent(self):
2001         self._check_variant_func(
2002             cephes.erfcx,
2003             lambda z: np.exp(z*z) * cephes.erfc(z),
2004             rtol=1e-12
2005             )
2006 
2007     def test_erfi_consistent(self):
2008         self._check_variant_func(
2009             cephes.erfi,
2010             lambda z: -1j * cephes.erf(1j*z),
2011             rtol=1e-12
2012             )
2013 
2014     def test_dawsn_consistent(self):
2015         self._check_variant_func(
2016             cephes.dawsn,
2017             lambda z: sqrt(pi)/2 * np.exp(-z*z) * cephes.erfi(z),
2018             rtol=1e-12
2019             )

2052 class TestEuler:
2053     def test_euler(self):
2054         eu0 = special.euler(0)
2055         eu1 = special.euler(1)
2056         eu2 = special.euler(2)   # just checking segfaults
2057         assert_allclose(eu0, [1], rtol=1e-15)
2058         assert_allclose(eu1, [1, 0], rtol=1e-15)
2059         assert_allclose(eu2, [1, 0, -1], rtol=1e-15)
2060         eu24 = special.euler(24)
2061         mathworld = [1,1,5,61,1385,50521,2702765,199360981,
2062                      19391512145,2404879675441,
2063                      370371188237525,69348874393137901,
2064                      15514534163557086905]
2065         correct = zeros((25,),'d')
2066         for k in range(0,13):
2067             if (k % 2):
2068                 correct[2*k] = -float(mathworld[k])
2069             else:
2070                 correct[2*k] = float(mathworld[k])
2071         with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
2072             err = nan_to_num((eu24-correct)/correct)
2073             errmax = max(err)
2074         assert_almost_equal(errmax, 0.0, 14)

2108 
2109 def assert_really_equal(x, y, rtol=None):
2110     """ 
2111     Sharper assertion function that is stricter about matching types, not just values 
2112  
2113     This is useful/necessary in some cases: 
2114       * dtypes for arrays that have the same _values_ (e.g. element 1.0 vs 1) 
2115       * distinguishing complex from real NaN 
2116       * result types for scalars 
2117  
2118     We still want to be able to allow a relative tolerance for the values though. 
2119     The main logic comparison logic is handled by the xp_assert_* functions. 
2120     """
2121     def assert_func(x, y):
2122         xp_assert_equal(x, y) if rtol is None else xp_assert_close(x, y, rtol=rtol)
2123 
2124     def assert_complex_nan(x):
2125         assert np.isnan(x.real) and np.isnan(x.imag)
2126 
2127     assert type(x) is type(y), f"types not equal: {type(x)}, {type(y)}"
2128 
2129     # ensure we also compare the values _within_ an array appropriately,
2130     # e.g. assert_equal does not distinguish different complex nans in arrays
2131     if isinstance(x, np.ndarray):
2132         # assert_equal does not compare (all) types, only values
2133         assert x.dtype == y.dtype
2134         # for empty arrays resp. to ensure shapes match
2135         assert_func(x, y)
2136         for elem_x, elem_y in zip(x.ravel(), y.ravel()):
2137             assert_really_equal(elem_x, elem_y, rtol=rtol)
2138     elif np.isnan(x) and np.isnan(y) and _is_subdtype(type(x), "c"):
2139         assert_complex_nan(x) and assert_complex_nan(y)
2140     # no need to consider complex infinities due to numpy/numpy#25493
2141     else:
2142         assert_func(x, y)
2143

2145 class TestFactorialFunctions:
2146     def factorialk_ref(self, n, k, exact, extend):
2147         if exact:
2148             return special.factorialk(n, k=k, exact=True)
2149         # for details / explanation see factorialk-docstring
2150         r = np.mod(n, k) if extend == "zero" else 1
2151         vals = np.power(k, (n - r)/k) * special.gamma(n/k + 1) * special.rgamma(r/k + 1)
2152         # np.maximum is element-wise, which is what we want
2153         return vals * np.maximum(r, 1)

2182     @pytest.mark.parametrize("n", [-1.1, -2.2, -3.3])
2183     def test_factorialx_negative_extend_complex(self, n):
2184         kw = {"extend": "complex"}

2198         assert_allclose(special.factorial([n], **kw)[0], exp_1[n], rtol=rtol)
2199         assert_allclose(special.factorial2([n], **kw)[0], exp_2[n], rtol=rtol)
2200         assert_allclose(special.factorialk([n], k=3, **kw)[0], exp_k[n], rtol=rtol)

2202     @pytest.mark.parametrize("imag", [0, 0j])
2203     @pytest.mark.parametrize("n_outer", [-1, -2, -3])
2204     def test_factorialx_negative_extend_complex_poles(self, n_outer, imag):
2205         kw = {"extend": "complex"}
2206         def _check(n):
2207             complexify = _is_subdtype(type(n), "c")
2208             # like for gamma, we expect complex nans for complex inputs
2209             complex_nan = np.complex128("nan+nanj")
2210             exp = np.complex128("nan+nanj") if complexify else np.float64("nan")
2211             # poles are at negative integers that are multiples of k
2212             assert_really_equal(special.factorial(n, **kw), exp)
2213             assert_really_equal(special.factorial2(n * 2, **kw), exp)
2214             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk(n * 3, k=3, **kw), exp)
2215             # also test complex k for factorialk
2216             c = 1.5 - 2j
2217             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk(n * c, k=c, **kw), complex_nan)
2218             # same for array case
2219             assert_really_equal(special.factorial([n], **kw)[0], exp)
2220             assert_really_equal(special.factorial2([n * 2], **kw)[0], exp)
2221             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk([n * 3], k=3, **kw)[0], exp)
2222             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk([n * c], k=c, **kw)[0], complex_nan)
2223             # more specific tests in test_factorial{,2,k}_complex_reference
2224 
2225         # imag ensures we test both real and complex representations of the poles
2226         _check(n_outer + imag)
2227         # check for large multiple of period
2228         _check(100_000 * n_outer + imag)

2230     @pytest.mark.parametrize("boxed", [True, False])
2231     @pytest.mark.parametrize("extend", ["zero", "complex"])
2232     @pytest.mark.parametrize(
2233         "n",
2234         [
2235             np.nan, np.float64("nan"), np.nan + np.nan*1j, np.complex128("nan+nanj"),
2236             np.inf, np.inf + 0j, -np.inf, -np.inf + 0j, None, np.datetime64("nat")
2237         ],
2238         ids=[
2239             "NaN", "np.float64('nan')", "NaN+i*NaN", "np.complex128('nan+nanj')",
2240             "inf", "inf+0i", "-inf", "-inf+0i", "None", "NaT"
2241         ]
2242     )
2243     @pytest.mark.parametrize(
2244         "factorialx",
2245         [special.factorial, special.factorial2, special.factorialk]
2246     )
2247     def test_factorialx_inf_nan(self, factorialx, n, extend, boxed):
2248         # NaNs not allowed (by dtype) for exact=True
2249         kw = {"exact": False, "extend": extend}
2250         if factorialx == special.factorialk:
2251             kw["k"] = 3
2252 
2253         # None is allowed for scalars, but would cause object type in array case
2254         permissible_types = ["i", "f", "c"] if boxed else ["i", "f", "c", type(None)]
2255         # factorial allows floats also for extend="zero"
2256         types_need_complex_ext = "c" if factorialx == special.factorial else ["f", "c"]
2257 
2258         if not _is_subdtype(type(n), permissible_types):
2259             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Unsupported data type.*"):
2260                 factorialx([n] if boxed else n, **kw)
2261         elif _is_subdtype(type(n), types_need_complex_ext) and extend != "complex":
2262             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="In order to use non-integer.*"):
2263                 factorialx([n] if boxed else n, **kw)
2264         else:
2265             # account for type and whether extend="complex"
2266             complexify = (extend == "complex") and _is_subdtype(type(n), "c")
2267             # note that the type of the naïve `np.nan + np.nan * 1j` is `complex`
2268             # instead of `numpy.complex128`, which trips up assert_really_equal
2269             expected = np.complex128("nan+nanj") if complexify else np.float64("nan")
2270             # the only exception are real infinities
2271             if _is_subdtype(type(n), "f") and np.isinf(n):
2272                 # unchanged for positive infinity; negative one depends on extension
2273                 neg_inf_result = np.float64(0 if (extend == "zero") else "nan")
2274                 expected = np.float64("inf") if (n > 0) else neg_inf_result
2275 
2276             result = factorialx([n], **kw)[0] if boxed else factorialx(n, **kw)
2277             assert_really_equal(result, expected)
2278             # also tested in test_factorial{,2,k}_{array,scalar}_corner_cases
2279

2289     @pytest.mark.parametrize("levels", range(1, 5))
2290     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact", [True, False])
2291     def test_factorialx_array_shape(self, levels, exact):
2292         def _nest_me(x, k=1):
2293             """ 
2294             Double x and nest it k times 
2295  
2296             For example: 
2297             >>> _nest_me([3, 4], 2) 
2298             [[[3, 4], [3, 4]], [[3, 4], [3, 4]]] 
2299             """
2300             if k == 0:
2301                 return x
2302             else:
2303                 return _nest_me([x, x], k-1)
2304 
2305         def _check(res, nucleus):
2306             exp = np.array(_nest_me(nucleus, k=levels), dtype=object)
2307             # test that ndarray shape is maintained
2308             # need to cast to float due to numpy/numpy#21220
2309             assert_allclose(res.astype(np.float64), exp.astype(np.float64))
2310 
2311         n = np.array(_nest_me([5, 25], k=levels))
2312         exp_nucleus = {1: [120, math.factorial(25)],
2313                        # correctness of factorial{2,k}() is tested elsewhere
2314                        2: [15, special.factorial2(25, exact=True)],
2315                        3: [10, special.factorialk(25, 3, exact=True)]}
2316 
2317         _check(special.factorial(n, exact=exact), exp_nucleus[1])
2318         _check(special.factorial2(n, exact=exact), exp_nucleus[2])
2319         _check(special.factorialk(n, 3, exact=exact), exp_nucleus[3])

2374     # note that n=170 is the last integer such that factorial(n) fits float64
2375     @pytest.mark.parametrize('n', range(30, 180, 10))
2376     def test_factorial_accuracy(self, n):
2377         # Compare exact=True vs False, i.e. that the accuracy of the

2387     @pytest.mark.parametrize('n',
2388                              list(range(0, 22)) + list(range(30, 180, 10)))
2389     def test_factorial_int_reference(self, n):
2390         # Compare all with math.factorial
2391         correct = math.factorial(n)
2392         assert_array_equal(correct, special.factorial(n, exact=True))
2393         assert_array_equal(correct, special.factorial([n], exact=True)[0])
2394 
2395         rtol = 8e-14 if sys.platform == 'win32' else 1e-15
2396         # need to cast exact result to float due to numpy/numpy#21220
2397         correct = float(correct)
2398         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial(n, exact=False), rtol=rtol)
2399         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial([n], exact=False)[0], rtol=rtol)
2400 
2401         # extend="complex" only works for exact=False
2402         kw = {"exact": False, "extend": "complex"}
2403         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial(n, **kw), rtol=rtol)
2404         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial([n], **kw)[0], rtol=rtol)

2406     def test_factorial_float_reference(self):
2407         def _check(n, expected):
2408             rtol = 8e-14 if sys.platform == 'win32' else 1e-15
2409             assert_allclose(special.factorial(n), expected, rtol=rtol)
2410             assert_allclose(special.factorial([n])[0], expected, rtol=rtol)
2411             # using floats with `exact=True` raises an error for scalars and arrays
2412             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="`exact=True` only supports.*"):
2413                 special.factorial(n, exact=True)
2414             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="`exact=True` only supports.*"):
2415                 special.factorial([n], exact=True)

2418         _check(0.01, 0.994325851191506032181932988)

2441         # close to poles

2445     @pytest.mark.parametrize("dtype", [np.int64, np.float64,
2446                                        np.complex128, object])
2447     @pytest.mark.parametrize("extend", ["zero", "complex"])
2448     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact", [True, False])
2449     @pytest.mark.parametrize("dim", range(0, 5))
2450     # test empty & non-empty arrays, with nans and mixed
2451     @pytest.mark.parametrize(
2452         "content",
2453         [[], [1], [1.1], [np.nan], [np.nan + np.nan * 1j], [np.nan, 1]],
2454         ids=["[]", "[1]", "[1.1]", "[NaN]", "[NaN+i*NaN]", "[NaN, 1]"],
2455     )
2456     def test_factorial_array_corner_cases(self, content, dim, exact, extend, dtype):
2457         if dtype is object and SCIPY_ARRAY_API:
2458             pytest.skip("object arrays unsupported in array API mode")
2459         # get dtype without calling array constructor (that might fail or mutate)
2460         if dtype is np.int64 and any(np.isnan(x) or (x != int(x)) for x in content):
2461             pytest.skip("impossible combination")
2462         if dtype == np.float64 and any(_is_subdtype(type(x), "c") for x in content):
2463             pytest.skip("impossible combination")
2464 
2465         kw = {"exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2466         # np.array(x, ndim=0) will not be 0-dim. unless x is too
2467         content = content if (dim > 0 or len(content) != 1) else content[0]
2468         n = np.array(content, ndmin=dim, dtype=dtype)
2469 
2470         result = None
2471         if extend == "complex" and exact:
2472             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Incompatible options:.*"):
2473                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2474         elif not _is_subdtype(n.dtype, ["i", "f", "c"]):
2475             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Unsupported data type.*"):
2476                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2477         elif _is_subdtype(n.dtype, "c") and extend != "complex":
2478             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="In order to use non-integer.*"):
2479                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2480         elif exact and not _is_subdtype(n.dtype, "i"):
2481             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="`exact=True` only supports.*"):
2482                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2483         else:
2484             result = special.factorial(n, **kw)
2485 
2486         if result is not None:
2487             # use scalar case as reference; tested separately in *_scalar_corner_cases
2488             ref = [special.factorial(x, **kw) for x in n.ravel()]
2489             # unpack length-1 lists so that np.array(x, ndim=0) works correctly
2490             ref = ref[0] if len(ref) == 1 else ref
2491             # result is empty if and only if n is empty, and has the same dimension
2492             # as n; dtype stays the same, except when not empty and not exact:
2493             if n.size:
2494                 cx = (extend == "complex") and _is_subdtype(n.dtype, "c")
2495                 dtype = np.complex128 if cx else (native_int if exact else np.float64)
2496             expected = np.array(ref, ndmin=dim, dtype=dtype)
2497             assert_really_equal(result, expected, rtol=1e-15)
2498 
2499     @pytest.mark.parametrize("extend", ["zero", "complex"])
2500     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact", [True, False])
2501     @pytest.mark.parametrize("n", [1, 1.1, 2 + 2j, np.nan, np.nan + np.nan*1j, None],
2502                              ids=["1", "1.1", "2+2j", "NaN", "NaN+i*NaN", "None"])
2503     def test_factorial_scalar_corner_cases(self, n, exact, extend):
2504         kw = {"exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2505         if extend == "complex" and exact:
2506             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Incompatible options:.*"):
2507                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2508         elif not _is_subdtype(type(n), ["i", "f", "c", type(None)]):
2509             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Unsupported data type.*"):
2510                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2511         elif _is_subdtype(type(n), "c") and extend != "complex":
2512             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="In order to use non-integer.*"):
2513                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2514         elif n is None or np.isnan(n):
2515             # account for dtype and whether extend="complex"
2516             complexify = (extend == "complex") and _is_subdtype(type(n), "c")
2517             expected = np.complex128("nan+nanj") if complexify else np.float64("nan")
2518             assert_really_equal(special.factorial(n, **kw), expected)
2519         elif exact and _is_subdtype(type(n), "f"):
2520             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="`exact=True` only supports.*"):
2521                 special.factorial(n, **kw)
2522         else:
2523             assert_equal(special.factorial(n, **kw), special.gamma(n + 1))

2538     @pytest.mark.parametrize('n',
2539                              list(range(0, 22)) + list(range(30, 180, 11)))
2540     def test_factorial2_int_reference(self, n):
2541         # Compare all with correct value
2542 
2543         # Cannot use np.product due to overflow
2544         correct = functools.reduce(operator.mul, list(range(n, 0, -2)), 1)
2545 
2546         assert_array_equal(correct, special.factorial2(n, exact=True))
2547         assert_array_equal(correct, special.factorial2([n], exact=True)[0])
2548 
2549         rtol = 2e-14 if sys.platform == 'win32' else 1e-15
2550         # need to cast exact result to float due to numpy/numpy#21220
2551         correct = float(correct)
2552         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial2(n, exact=False), rtol=rtol)
2553         assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial2([n], exact=False)[0], rtol=rtol)
2554 
2555         # extend="complex" only works for exact=False
2556         kw = {"exact": False, "extend": "complex"}
2557         # approximation only matches exactly for `n == 1 (mod k)`, see docstring
2558         if n % 2 == 1:
2559             assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial2(n, **kw), rtol=rtol)
2560             assert_allclose(correct, special.factorial2([n], **kw)[0], rtol=rtol)

2707         # mpmath.power(k, (n-1)/k) * mpmath.gamma(n/k + 1) / mpmath.gamma(1/k + 1)

2709         _check(n=5, k=3, exp=7.29011132947227083)

2712         _check(n=3, k=2.5, exp=2.58465740293218541)
2713         _check(n=11, k=2.5, exp=1963.5)  # ==11*8.5*6*3.5; c.f. n == 1 (mod k)

2715         # complex values
2716         _check(n=4 + 4j, k=4, exp=-0.67855904082768043854 + 2.1993925819930311497j)
2717         _check(n=4, k=4 - 4j, exp=1.9775338957222718742 + 0.92607172675423901371j)
2718         _check(n=4 + 4j, k=4 - 4j, exp=0.1868492880824934475 + 0.87660580316894290247j)
2719         # negative values
2720         _check(n=-0.5, k=3, exp=0.72981013240713739354)
2721         _check(n=-0.5 + 0j, k=3, exp=0.72981013240713739354 + 0j)
2722         _check(n=2.9, k=-0.7, exp=0.45396591474966867296 + 0.56925525174685228866j)
2723         _check(n=-0.6, k=-0.7, exp=-0.07190820089634757334 - 0.090170031876701730081j)
2724         # close to poles
2725         _check(n=-2.9999, k=3, exp=7764.7170695908828364)
2726         _check(n=-3 + 0.0001j, k=3, exp=0.1349475632879599864 - 7764.5821055158365027j)

2762             result = special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2763 
2764         if result is not None:
2765             # use scalar case as reference; tested separately in *_scalar_corner_cases
2766             ref = [special.factorialk(x, **kw) for x in n.ravel()]
2767             # unpack length-1 lists so that np.array(x, ndim=0) works correctly
2768             ref = ref[0] if len(ref) == 1 else ref
2769             # result is empty if and only if n is empty, and has the same dimension
2770             # as n; dtype stays the same, except when not empty and not exact:
2771             if n.size:
2772                 cx = (extend == "complex") and _is_subdtype(n.dtype, "c")
2773                 dtype = np.complex128 if cx else (native_int if exact else np.float64)
2774             expected = np.array(ref, ndmin=dim, dtype=dtype)
2775             assert_really_equal(result, expected, rtol=2e-15)
2776 
2777     @pytest.mark.parametrize("extend", ["zero", "complex"])
2778     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact", [True, False])
2779     @pytest.mark.parametrize("k", range(1, 5))
2780     @pytest.mark.parametrize("n", [1, 1.1, 2 + 2j, np.nan, np.nan + np.nan*1j, None],
2781                              ids=["1", "1.1", "2+2j", "NaN", "NaN+i*NaN", "None"])
2782     def test_factorialk_scalar_corner_cases(self, n, k, exact, extend):
2783         kw = {"k": k, "exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2784         if extend == "complex" and exact:
2785             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Incompatible options:.*"):
2786                 special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2787         elif not _is_subdtype(type(n), ["i", "f", "c", type(None)]):
2788             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Unsupported data type.*"):
2789                 special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2790         elif _is_subdtype(type(n), ["f", "c"]) and extend != "complex":
2791             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="In order to use non-integer.*"):
2792                 special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2793         elif n is None or np.isnan(n):
2794             # account for dtype and whether extend="complex"
2795             complexify = (extend == "complex") and _is_subdtype(type(n), "c")
2796             expected = np.complex128("nan+nanj") if complexify else np.float64("nan")
2797             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk(n, **kw), expected)
2798         else:
2799             expected = self.factorialk_ref(n, **kw)
2800             assert_really_equal(special.factorialk(n, **kw), expected, rtol=1e-15)
2801 
2802     @pytest.mark.parametrize("boxed", [True, False])
2803     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact,extend",
2804                              [(True, "zero"), (False, "zero"), (False, "complex")])
2805     @pytest.mark.parametrize("k", [-1, -1.0, 0, 0.0, 0 + 1j, 1.1, np.nan])
2806     def test_factorialk_raises_k_complex(self, k, exact, extend, boxed):
2807         n = [1] if boxed else 1
2808         kw = {"k": k, "exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2809         if extend == "zero":
2810             msg = "In order to use non-integer.*"
2811             if _is_subdtype(type(k), "i") and (k < 1):
2812                 msg = "For `extend='zero'`.*"
2813             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match=msg):
2814                 special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2815         elif k == 0:
2816             with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Parameter k cannot be zero!"):
2817                 special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2818         else:
2819             # no error
2820             special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2821 
2822     @pytest.mark.parametrize("boxed", [True, False])
2823     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact,extend",
2824                              [(True, "zero"), (False, "zero"), (False, "complex")])
2825     # neither integer, float nor complex
2826     @pytest.mark.parametrize("k", ["string", np.datetime64("nat")],
2827                              ids=["string", "NaT"])
2828     def test_factorialk_raises_k_other(self, k, exact, extend, boxed):
2829         n = [1] if boxed else 1
2830         kw = {"k": k, "exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2831         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="Unsupported data type.*"):
2832             special.factorialk(n, **kw)
2833 
2834     @pytest.mark.parametrize("exact,extend",
2835                              [(True, "zero"), (False, "zero"), (False, "complex")])
2836     @pytest.mark.parametrize("k", range(1, 12))
2837     def test_factorialk_dtype(self, k, exact, extend):
2838         kw = {"k": k, "exact": exact, "extend": extend}
2839         if exact and k in _FACTORIALK_LIMITS_64BITS.keys():
2840             n = np.array([_FACTORIALK_LIMITS_32BITS[k]])
2841             assert_equal(special.factorialk(n, **kw).dtype, np_long)
2842             assert_equal(special.factorialk(n + 1, **kw).dtype, np.int64)
2843             # assert maximality of limits for given dtype
2844             assert special.factorialk(n + 1, **kw) > np.iinfo(np.int32).max
2845 
2846             n = np.array([_FACTORIALK_LIMITS_64BITS[k]])
2847             assert_equal(special.factorialk(n, **kw).dtype, np.int64)
2848             assert_equal(special.factorialk(n + 1, **kw).dtype, object)
2849             assert special.factorialk(n + 1, **kw) > np.iinfo(np.int64).max
2850         else:
2851             n = np.array([_FACTORIALK_LIMITS_64BITS.get(k, 1)])
2852             # for exact=True and k >= 10, we always return object;
2853             # for exact=False it's always float (unless input is complex)
2854             dtype = object if exact else np.float64
2855             assert_equal(special.factorialk(n, **kw).dtype, dtype)
2856 
2857     def test_factorial_mixed_nan_inputs(self):
2858         x = np.array([np.nan, 1, 2, 3, np.nan])
2859         expected = np.array([np.nan, 1, 2, 6, np.nan])
2860         assert_equal(special.factorial(x, exact=False), expected)
2861         with pytest.raises(ValueError, match="`exact=True` only supports.*"):
2862             special.factorial(x, exact=True)

2865 class TestFresnel:
2866     @pytest.mark.parametrize("z, s, c", [
2867         # some positive value
2868         (.5, 0.064732432859999287, 0.49234422587144644),
2869         (.5 + .0j, 0.064732432859999287, 0.49234422587144644),
2870         # negative half annulus
2871         # https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/12309
2872         # Reference values can be reproduced with
2873         # https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=FresnelS%5B-2.0+%2B+0.1i%5D
2874         # https://www.wolframalpha.com/input/?i=FresnelC%5B-2.0+%2B+0.1i%5D
2875         (
2876             -2.0 + 0.1j,
2877             -0.3109538687728942-0.0005870728836383176j,
2878             -0.4879956866358554+0.10670801832903172j
2879         ),
2880         (
2881             -0.1 - 1.5j,
2882             -0.03918309471866977+0.7197508454568574j,
2883             0.09605692502968956-0.43625191013617465j
2884         ),
2885         # a different algorithm kicks in for "large" values, i.e., |z| >= 4.5,
2886         # make sure to test both float and complex values; a different
2887         # algorithm is used
2888         (6.0, 0.44696076, 0.49953147),
2889         (6.0 + 0.0j, 0.44696076, 0.49953147),
2890         (6.0j, -0.44696076j, 0.49953147j),
2891         (-6.0 + 0.0j, -0.44696076, -0.49953147),
2892         (-6.0j, 0.44696076j, -0.49953147j),
2893         # inf
2894         (np.inf, 0.5, 0.5),
2895         (-np.inf, -0.5, -0.5),
2896     ])
2897     def test_fresnel_values(self, z, s, c):
2898         frs = array(special.fresnel(z))
2899         assert_array_almost_equal(frs, array([s, c]), 8)
2900 
2901     # values from pg 329  Table 7.11 of A & S
2902     #  slightly corrected in 4th decimal place
2903     def test_fresnel_zeros(self):
2904         szo, czo = special.fresnel_zeros(5)
2905         assert_array_almost_equal(szo,
2906                                   array([2.0093+0.2885j,
2907                                           2.8335+0.2443j,
2908                                           3.4675+0.2185j,
2909                                           4.0026+0.2009j,
2910                                           4.4742+0.1877j]),3)
2911         assert_array_almost_equal(czo,
2912                                   array([1.7437+0.3057j,
2913                                           2.6515+0.2529j,
2914                                           3.3204+0.2240j,
2915                                           3.8757+0.2047j,
2916                                           4.3611+0.1907j]),3)
2917         vals1 = special.fresnel(szo)[0]
2918         vals2 = special.fresnel(czo)[1]
2919         assert_array_almost_equal(vals1,0,14)
2920         assert_array_almost_equal(vals2,0,14)
2921

2948     @with_special_errors
2949     def test_gammaincinv(self):
2950         y = special.gammaincinv(.4,.4)
2951         x = special.gammainc(.4,y)
2952         assert_almost_equal(x,0.4,1)
2953         y = special.gammainc(10, 0.05)
2954         x = special.gammaincinv(10, 2.5715803516000736e-20)
2955         assert_almost_equal(0.05, x, decimal=10)
2956         assert_almost_equal(y, 2.5715803516000736e-20, decimal=10)
2957         x = special.gammaincinv(50, 8.20754777388471303050299243573393e-18)
2958         assert_almost_equal(11.0, x, decimal=10)
2959 
2960     @with_special_errors
2961     def test_975(self):
2962         # Regression test for ticket #975 -- switch point in algorithm
2963         # check that things work OK at the point, immediately next floats
2964         # around it, and a bit further away
2965         pts = [0.25,
2966                np.nextafter(0.25, 0), 0.25 - 1e-12,
2967                np.nextafter(0.25, 1), 0.25 + 1e-12]
2968         for xp in pts:
2969             y = special.gammaincinv(.4, xp)
2970             x = special.gammainc(0.4, y)
2971             assert_allclose(x, xp, rtol=1e-12)
2972

2981     @pytest.mark.parametrize(

2984             # infinities

2987             ([-0.0, 0.0], [-np.inf, np.inf]),
2988             # small poles
2989             (range(-32, 0), np.full(32, np.nan)),
2990             # medium sized poles
2991             (range(-1024, -32, 99), np.full(11, np.nan)),
2992             # large pole
2993             ([-4.141512231792294e+16], [np.nan]),
2994         ]
2995     )
2996     def test_poles(self, x, expected):
2997         assert_array_equal(special.gamma(x), expected)

3052     def test_hyp0f1(self):
3053         # scalar input
3054         assert_allclose(special.hyp0f1(2.5, 0.5), 1.21482702689997, rtol=1e-12)
3055         assert_allclose(special.hyp0f1(2.5, 0), 1.0, rtol=1e-15)
3056 
3057         # float input, expected values match mpmath
3058         x = special.hyp0f1(3.0, [-1.5, -1, 0, 1, 1.5])
3059         expected = np.array([0.58493659229143, 0.70566805723127, 1.0,
3060                              1.37789689539747, 1.60373685288480])
3061         assert_allclose(x, expected, rtol=1e-12)
3062 
3063         # complex input
3064         x = special.hyp0f1(3.0, np.array([-1.5, -1, 0, 1, 1.5]) + 0.j)
3065         assert_allclose(x, expected.astype(complex), rtol=1e-12)
3066 
3067         # test broadcasting
3068         x1 = [0.5, 1.5, 2.5]
3069         x2 = [0, 1, 0.5]
3070         x = special.hyp0f1(x1, x2)
3071         expected = [1.0, 1.8134302039235093, 1.21482702689997]
3072         assert_allclose(x, expected, rtol=1e-12)
3073         x = special.hyp0f1(np.vstack([x1] * 2), x2)
3074         assert_allclose(x, np.vstack([expected] * 2), rtol=1e-12)
3075         assert_raises(ValueError, special.hyp0f1,
3076                       np.vstack([x1] * 3), [0, 1])

3210     def test_hyp2f1(self):
3211         # a collection of special cases taken from AMS 55
3212         values = [
3213             [0.5, 1, 1.5, 0.2**2, 0.5/0.2*log((1+0.2)/(1-0.2))],
3214             [0.5, 1, 1.5, -0.2**2, 1./0.2*arctan(0.2)],
3215             [1, 1, 2, 0.2, -1/0.2*log(1-0.2)],
3216             [3, 3.5, 1.5, 0.2**2, 0.5/0.2/(-5)*((1+0.2)**(-5)-(1-0.2)**(-5))],
3217             [-3, 3, 0.5, sin(0.2)**2, cos(2*3*0.2)],
3218             [3, 4, 8, 1,
3219              special.gamma(8) * special.gamma(8-4-3)
3220              / special.gamma(8-3) / special.gamma(8-4)],
3221             [3, 2, 3-2+1, -1,
3222              1./2**3*sqrt(pi) * special.gamma(1+3-2)
3223              / special.gamma(1+0.5*3-2) / special.gamma(0.5+0.5*3)],
3224             [5, 2, 5-2+1, -1,
3225              1./2**5*sqrt(pi) * special.gamma(1+5-2)
3226              / special.gamma(1+0.5*5-2) / special.gamma(0.5+0.5*5)],
3227             [4, 0.5+4, 1.5-2*4, -1./3,
3228              (8./9)**(-2*4)*special.gamma(4./3) * special.gamma(1.5-2*4)
3229              / special.gamma(3./2) / special.gamma(4./3-2*4)],
3230             # and some others
3231             # ticket #424
3232             [1.5, -0.5, 1.0, -10.0, 4.1300097765277476484],
3233             # negative integer a or b, with c-a-b integer and x > 0.9
3234             [-2,3,1,0.95,0.715],
3235             [2,-3,1,0.95,-0.007],
3236             [-6,3,1,0.95,0.0000810625],
3237             [2,-5,1,0.95,-0.000029375],
3238             # huge negative integers
3239             (10, -900, 10.5, 0.99, 1.91853705796607664803709475658e-24),
3240             (10, -900, -10.5, 0.99, 3.54279200040355710199058559155e-18),
3241         ]
3242         for i, (a, b, c, x, v) in enumerate(values):
3243             cv = special.hyp2f1(a, b, c, x)
3244             assert_almost_equal(cv, v, 8, err_msg='test #%d' % i)
3245

3247         val1 = special.hyperu(1,0.1,100)
3248         assert_almost_equal(val1,0.0098153,7)
3249         a,b = [0.3,0.6,1.2,-2.7],[1.5,3.2,-0.4,-3.2]
3250         a,b = asarray(a), asarray(b)
3251         z = 0.5
3252         hypu = special.hyperu(a,b,z)
3253         hprl = (pi/sin(pi*b))*(special.hyp1f1(a,b,z) /
3254                                (special.gamma(1+a-b)*special.gamma(b)) -
3255                                z**(1-b)*special.hyp1f1(1+a-b,2-b,z)
3256                                / (special.gamma(a)*special.gamma(2-b)))
3257         assert_array_almost_equal(hypu,hprl,12)

3369     def test_jnjnp_zeros(self):
3370         jn = special.jn
3371 
3372         def jnp(n, x):
3373             return (jn(n-1,x) - jn(n+1,x))/2
3374         for nt in range(1, 30):
3375             z, n, m, t = special.jnjnp_zeros(nt)
3376             for zz, nn, tt in zip(z, n, t):
3377                 if tt == 0:
3378                     assert_allclose(jn(nn, zz), 0, atol=1e-6)
3379                 elif tt == 1:
3380                     assert_allclose(jnp(nn, zz), 0, atol=1e-6)
3381                 else:
3382                     raise AssertionError("Invalid t return for nt=%d" % nt)
3383

3442     def test_jacobi(self):
3443         a = 5*np.random.random() - 1
3444         b = 5*np.random.random() - 1
3445         P0 = special.jacobi(0,a,b)
3446         P1 = special.jacobi(1,a,b)
3447         P2 = special.jacobi(2,a,b)
3448         P3 = special.jacobi(3,a,b)
3449 
3450         assert_array_almost_equal(P0.c,[1],13)
3451         assert_array_almost_equal(P1.c,array([a+b+2,a-b])/2.0,13)
3452         cp = [(a+b+3)*(a+b+4), 4*(a+b+3)*(a+2), 4*(a+1)*(a+2)]
3453         p2c = [cp[0],cp[1]-2*cp[0],cp[2]-cp[1]+cp[0]]
3454         assert_array_almost_equal(P2.c,array(p2c)/8.0,13)
3455         cp = [(a+b+4)*(a+b+5)*(a+b+6),6*(a+b+4)*(a+b+5)*(a+3),
3456               12*(a+b+4)*(a+2)*(a+3),8*(a+1)*(a+2)*(a+3)]
3457         p3c = [cp[0],cp[1]-3*cp[0],cp[2]-2*cp[1]+3*cp[0],cp[3]-cp[2]+cp[1]-cp[0]]
3458         assert_array_almost_equal(P3.c,array(p3c)/48.0,13)

3508     def test_kvp_n2(self):
3509         v = 3.
3510         z = 2.2
3511         xc = (z**2+v**2-v)/z**2 * special.kv(v,z) + special.kv(v+1,z)/z
3512         x = special.kvp(v, z, n=2)
3513         assert_almost_equal(xc, x, 10)

3599     def _cephes_vs_amos_points(self):
3600         """Yield points at which to compare Cephes implementation to AMOS"""
3601         # check several points, including large-amplitude ones
3602         v = [-120, -100.3, -20., -10., -1., -.5, 0., 1., 12.49, 120., 301]
3603         z = [-1300, -11, -10, -1, 1., 10., 200.5, 401., 600.5, 700.6, 1300,
3604              10003]
3605         yield from itertools.product(v, z)
3606 
3607         # check half-integers; these are problematic points at least
3608         # for cephes/iv
3609         yield from itertools.product(0.5 + arange(-60, 60), [3.5])
3610 
3611     def check_cephes_vs_amos(self, f1, f2, rtol=1e-11, atol=0, skip=None):
3612         for v, z in self._cephes_vs_amos_points():
3613             if skip is not None and skip(v, z):
3614                 continue
3615             c1, c2, c3 = f1(v, z), f1(v,z+0j), f2(int(v), z)
3616             if np.isinf(c1):
3617                 assert_(np.abs(c2) >= 1e300, (v, z))
3618             elif np.isnan(c1):
3619                 assert_(c2.imag != 0, (v, z))
3620             else:
3621                 assert_allclose(c1, c2, err_msg=(v, z), rtol=rtol, atol=atol)
3622                 if v == int(v):
3623                     assert_allclose(c3, c2, err_msg=(v, z),
3624                                      rtol=rtol, atol=atol)
3625 
3626     @pytest.mark.xfail(platform.machine() == 'ppc64le',
3627                        reason="fails on ppc64le")
3628     def test_jv_cephes_vs_amos(self):
3629         self.check_cephes_vs_amos(special.jv, special.jn, rtol=1e-10, atol=1e-305)
3630 
3631     @pytest.mark.xfail(platform.machine() == 'ppc64le',
3632                        reason="fails on ppc64le")
3633     def test_yv_cephes_vs_amos(self):
3634         self.check_cephes_vs_amos(special.yv, special.yn, rtol=1e-11, atol=1e-305)
3635 
3636     def test_yv_cephes_vs_amos_only_small_orders(self):
3637         def skipper(v, z):
3638             return abs(v) > 50
3639         self.check_cephes_vs_amos(special.yv, special.yn, rtol=1e-11, atol=1e-305,
3640                                   skip=skipper)
3641 
3642     def test_iv_cephes_vs_amos(self):
3643         with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
3644             self.check_cephes_vs_amos(special.iv, special.iv, rtol=5e-9, atol=1e-305)
3645 
3646     @pytest.mark.slow
3647     def test_iv_cephes_vs_amos_mass_test(self):
3648         N = 1000000
3649         np.random.seed(1)
3650         v = np.random.pareto(0.5, N) * (-1)**np.random.randint(2, size=N)
3651         x = np.random.pareto(0.2, N) * (-1)**np.random.randint(2, size=N)
3652 
3653         imsk = (np.random.randint(8, size=N) == 0)
3654         v[imsk] = v[imsk].astype(np.int64)
3655 
3656         with np.errstate(all='ignore'):
3657             c1 = special.iv(v, x)
3658             c2 = special.iv(v, x+0j)
3659 
3660             # deal with differences in the inf and zero cutoffs
3661             c1[abs(c1) > 1e300] = np.inf
3662             c2[abs(c2) > 1e300] = np.inf
3663             c1[abs(c1) < 1e-300] = 0
3664             c2[abs(c2) < 1e-300] = 0
3665 
3666             dc = abs(c1/c2 - 1)
3667             dc[np.isnan(dc)] = 0
3668 
3669         k = np.argmax(dc)
3670 
3671         # Most error apparently comes from AMOS and not our implementation;
3672         # there are some problems near integer orders there
3673         assert_(
3674             dc[k] < 2e-7,
3675             (v[k], x[k], special.iv(v[k], x[k]), special.iv(v[k], x[k]+0j))
3676         )
3677

3687     def test_ticket_853(self):

3691         assert_allclose(special.jv(-2, 1), 0.1149034849319005)
3692         assert_allclose(special.yv(-1, 1), 0.7812128213002887)
3693         assert_allclose(special.yv(-2, 1), -1.650682606816255)
3694         assert_allclose(special.iv(-1, 1), 0.5651591039924851)
3695         assert_allclose(special.iv(-2, 1), 0.1357476697670383)

3697         assert_allclose(special.kv(-2, 1), 1.624838898635178)
3698         assert_allclose(special.jv(-0.5, 1), 0.43109886801837607952)
3699         assert_allclose(special.yv(-0.5, 1), 0.6713967071418031)
3700         assert_allclose(special.iv(-0.5, 1), 1.231200214592967)
3701         assert_allclose(special.kv(-0.5, 1), 0.4610685044478945)
3702         # amos
3703         assert_allclose(special.jv(-1, 1+0j), -0.4400505857449335)
3704         assert_allclose(special.jv(-2, 1+0j), 0.1149034849319005)
3705         assert_allclose(special.yv(-1, 1+0j), 0.7812128213002887)
3706         assert_allclose(special.yv(-2, 1+0j), -1.650682606816255)
3707 
3708         assert_allclose(special.iv(-1, 1+0j), 0.5651591039924851)
3709         assert_allclose(special.iv(-2, 1+0j), 0.1357476697670383)
3710         assert_allclose(special.kv(-1, 1+0j), 0.6019072301972347)
3711         assert_allclose(special.kv(-2, 1+0j), 1.624838898635178)
3712 
3713         assert_allclose(special.jv(-0.5, 1+0j), 0.43109886801837607952)
3714         assert_allclose(special.jv(-0.5, 1+1j), 0.2628946385649065-0.827050182040562j)
3715         assert_allclose(special.yv(-0.5, 1+0j), 0.6713967071418031)
3716         assert_allclose(special.yv(-0.5, 1+1j), 0.967901282890131+0.0602046062142816j)
3717 
3718         assert_allclose(special.iv(-0.5, 1+0j), 1.231200214592967)
3719         assert_allclose(special.iv(-0.5, 1+1j), 0.77070737376928+0.39891821043561j)
3720         assert_allclose(special.kv(-0.5, 1+0j), 0.4610685044478945)
3721         assert_allclose(special.kv(-0.5, 1+1j), 0.06868578341999-0.38157825981268j)
3722 
3723         assert_allclose(special.jve(-0.5,1+0.3j), special.jv(-0.5, 1+0.3j)*exp(-0.3))
3724         assert_allclose(special.yve(-0.5,1+0.3j), special.yv(-0.5, 1+0.3j)*exp(-0.3))
3725         assert_allclose(special.ive(-0.5,0.3+1j), special.iv(-0.5, 0.3+1j)*exp(-0.3))
3726         assert_allclose(special.kve(-0.5,0.3+1j), special.kv(-0.5, 0.3+1j)*exp(0.3+1j))
3727 
3728         assert_allclose(
3729             special.hankel1(-0.5, 1+1j),
3730             special.jv(-0.5, 1+1j) + 1j*special.yv(-0.5,1+1j)
3731         )
3732         assert_allclose(
3733             special.hankel2(-0.5, 1+1j),
3734             special.jv(-0.5, 1+1j) - 1j*special.yv(-0.5,1+1j)
3735         )

3766     def iv_series(self, v, z, n=200):
3767         k = arange(0, n).astype(double)
3768         r = (v+2*k)*log(.5*z) - special.gammaln(k+1) - special.gammaln(v+k+1)
3769         r[isnan(r)] = inf
3770         r = exp(r)
3771         err = abs(r).max() * finfo(double).eps * n + abs(r[-1])*10
3772         return r.sum(), err
3773 
3774     def test_i0_series(self):
3775         for z in [1., 10., 200.5]:
3776             value, err = self.iv_series(0, z)
3777             assert_allclose(special.i0(z), value, atol=err, err_msg=z)

3864 class TestLaguerre:
3865     def test_laguerre(self):

3867         lag1 = special.laguerre(1)
3868         lag2 = special.laguerre(2)
