3873         assert_array_almost_equal(lag1.c,[-1,1],13)
3874         assert_array_almost_equal(lag2.c,array([1,-4,2])/2.0,13)
3875         assert_array_almost_equal(lag3.c,array([-1,9,-18,6])/6.0,13)
3876         assert_array_almost_equal(lag4.c,array([1,-16,72,-96,24])/24.0,13)
3877         assert_array_almost_equal(lag5.c,array([-1,25,-200,600,-600,120])/120.0,13)

3879     def test_genlaguerre(self):
3880         k = 5*np.random.random() - 0.9
3881         lag0 = special.genlaguerre(0,k)
3882         lag1 = special.genlaguerre(1,k)
3883         lag2 = special.genlaguerre(2,k)
3884         lag3 = special.genlaguerre(3,k)
3885         assert_equal(lag0.c, [1])
3886         assert_equal(lag1.c, [-1, k + 1])
3887         assert_almost_equal(
3888             lag2.c,
3889             array([1,-2*(k+2),(k+1.)*(k+2.)])/2.0
3890         )
3891         assert_almost_equal(
3892             lag3.c,
3893             array([-1,3*(k+3),-3*(k+2)*(k+3),(k+1)*(k+2)*(k+3)])/6.0
3894         )

3968     def test_pbdv_points(self):
3969         # simple case
3970         eta = np.linspace(-10, 10, 5)
3971         z = 2**(eta/2)*np.sqrt(np.pi)*special.rgamma(.5-.5*eta)
3972         assert_allclose(special.pbdv(eta, 0.)[0], z, rtol=1e-14, atol=1e-14)
3973 
3974         # some points
3975         assert_allclose(special.pbdv(10.34, 20.44)[0], 1.3731383034455e-32, rtol=1e-12)
3976         assert_allclose(special.pbdv(-9.53, 3.44)[0], 3.166735001119246e-8, rtol=1e-12)
3977 
3978     def test_pbdv_gradient(self):
3979         x = np.linspace(-4, 4, 8)[:,None]
3980         eta = np.linspace(-10, 10, 5)[None,:]
3981 
3982         p = special.pbdv(eta, x)
3983         eps = 1e-7 + 1e-7*abs(x)
3984         dp = (special.pbdv(eta, x + eps)[0] - special.pbdv(eta, x - eps)[0]) / eps / 2.
3985         assert_allclose(p[1], dp, rtol=1e-6, atol=1e-6)
3986

3989         eta = np.linspace(-10, 10, 5)[None,:]
3990 
3991         p = special.pbvv(eta, x)
3992         eps = 1e-7 + 1e-7*abs(x)
3993         dp = (special.pbvv(eta, x + eps)[0] - special.pbvv(eta, x - eps)[0]) / eps / 2.
3994         assert_allclose(p[1], dp, rtol=1e-6, atol=1e-6)

4006 class TestPolygamma:

4022                     -0.23620405164172739]

4026                             expected)

4056 class TestRiccati:
4057     def test_riccati_jn(self):
4058         N, x = 2, 0.2
4059         S = np.empty((N, N))
4060         for n in range(N):
4061             j = special.spherical_jn(n, x)
4062             jp = special.spherical_jn(n, x, derivative=True)
4063             S[0,n] = x*j
4064             S[1,n] = x*jp + j
4065         assert_array_almost_equal(S, special.riccati_jn(n, x), 8)
4066 
4067     def test_riccati_yn(self):
4068         N, x = 2, 0.2
4069         C = np.empty((N, N))
4070         for n in range(N):
4071             y = special.spherical_yn(n, x)
4072             yp = special.spherical_yn(n, x, derivative=True)
4073             C[0,n] = x*y
4074             C[1,n] = x*yp + y
4075         assert_array_almost_equal(C, special.riccati_yn(n, x), 8)

4078 class TestSoftplus:
4079     def test_softplus(self):
4080         # Test cases for the softplus function. Selected based on Eq.(10) of:
4081         # Mächler, M. (2012). log1mexp-note.pdf. Rmpfr: R MPFR - Multiple Precision
4082         # Floating-Point Reliable. Retrieved from:
4083         # https://cran.r-project.org/web/packages/Rmpfr/vignettes/log1mexp-note.pdf
4084         # Reference values computed with `mpmath`
4085         import numpy as np
4086         rng = np.random.default_rng(3298432985245)
4087         n = 3
4088         a1 = rng.uniform(-100, -37, size=n)
4089         a2 = rng.uniform(-37, 18, size=n)
4090         a3 = rng.uniform(18, 33.3, size=n)
4091         a4 = rng.uniform(33.33, 100, size=n)
4092         a = np.stack([a1, a2, a3, a4])
4093 
4094         # from mpmath import mp
4095         # mp.dps = 100
4096         # @np.vectorize
4097         # def softplus(x):
4098         #     return float(mp.log(mp.one + mp.exp(x)))
4099         # softplus(a).tolist()
4100         ref = [[1.692721323272333e-42, 7.42673911145206e-41, 8.504608846033205e-35],
4101                [1.8425343736349797, 9.488245799395577e-15, 7.225195764021444e-08],
4102                [31.253760266045106, 27.758244090327832, 29.995959179643634],
4103                [73.26040086468937, 76.24944728617226, 37.83955519155184]]
4104 
4105         res = softplus(a)
4106         assert_allclose(res, ref, rtol=2e-15)
4107 
4108     def test_softplus_with_kwargs(self):
4109         x = np.arange(5) - 2
4110         out = np.ones(5)
4111         ref = out.copy()
4112         where = x > 0
4113 
4114         softplus(x, out=out, where=where)
4115         ref[where] = softplus(x[where])
4116         assert_allclose(out, ref)

4134 # sph_harm is deprecated and is implemented as a shim around sph_harm_y.
4135 # The following two tests are maintained to verify the correctness of the shim.
4136 
4137 def test_sph_harm():
4138     # Tests derived from tables in
4139     # https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Table_of_spherical_harmonics
4140     sh = special.sph_harm
4141     pi = np.pi
4142     exp = np.exp
4143     sqrt = np.sqrt
4144     sin = np.sin
4145     cos = np.cos
4146     with suppress_warnings() as sup:
4147         sup.filter(category=DeprecationWarning)
4148         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(0,0,0,0),
4149                0.5/sqrt(pi))
4150         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(-2,2,0.,pi/4),
4151                0.25*sqrt(15./(2.*pi)) *
4152                (sin(pi/4))**2.)
4153         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(-2,2,0.,pi/2),
4154                0.25*sqrt(15./(2.*pi)))
4155         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(2,2,pi,pi/2),
4156                0.25*sqrt(15/(2.*pi)) *
4157                exp(0+2.*pi*1j)*sin(pi/2.)**2.)
4158         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(2,4,pi/4.,pi/3.),
4159                (3./8.)*sqrt(5./(2.*pi)) *
4160                exp(0+2.*pi/4.*1j) *
4161                sin(pi/3.)**2. *
4162                (7.*cos(pi/3.)**2.-1))
4163         assert_array_almost_equal(sh(4,4,pi/8.,pi/6.),
4164                (3./16.)*sqrt(35./(2.*pi)) *
4165                exp(0+4.*pi/8.*1j)*sin(pi/6.)**4.)

4168 def test_sph_harm_ufunc_loop_selection():
4169     # see https://github.com/scipy/scipy/issues/4895
4170     dt = np.dtype(np.complex128)
4171     with suppress_warnings() as sup:
4172         sup.filter(category=DeprecationWarning)
4173         assert_equal(special.sph_harm(0, 0, 0, 0).dtype, dt)
4174         assert_equal(special.sph_harm([0], 0, 0, 0).dtype, dt)
4175         assert_equal(special.sph_harm(0, [0], 0, 0).dtype, dt)
4176         assert_equal(special.sph_harm(0, 0, [0], 0).dtype, dt)
4177         assert_equal(special.sph_harm(0, 0, 0, [0]).dtype, dt)

4181 class TestStruve:
4182     def _series(self, v, z, n=100):
4183         """Compute Struve function & error estimate from its power series."""
4184         k = arange(0, n)
4185         r = (-1)**k * (.5*z)**(2*k+v+1)/special.gamma(k+1.5)/special.gamma(k+v+1.5)
4186         err = abs(r).max() * finfo(double).eps * n
4187         return r.sum(), err
4188 
4189     def test_vs_series(self):
4190         """Check Struve function versus its power series"""
4191         for v in [-20, -10, -7.99, -3.4, -1, 0, 1, 3.4, 12.49, 16]:
4192             for z in [1, 10, 19, 21, 30]:
4193                 value, err = self._series(v, z)
4194                 assert_allclose(special.struve(v, z), value, rtol=0, atol=err), (v, z)
4195 
4196     def test_some_values(self):
4197         assert_allclose(special.struve(-7.99, 21), 0.0467547614113, rtol=1e-7)
4198         assert_allclose(special.struve(-8.01, 21), 0.0398716951023, rtol=1e-8)
4199         assert_allclose(special.struve(-3.0, 200), 0.0142134427432, rtol=1e-12)
4200         assert_allclose(special.struve(-8.0, -41), 0.0192469727846, rtol=1e-11)
4201         assert_equal(special.struve(-12, -41), -special.struve(-12, 41))
4202         assert_equal(special.struve(+12, -41), -special.struve(+12, 41))
4203         assert_equal(special.struve(-11, -41), +special.struve(-11, 41))
4204         assert_equal(special.struve(+11, -41), +special.struve(+11, 41))
4205 
4206         assert_(isnan(special.struve(-7.1, -1)))
4207         assert_(isnan(special.struve(-10.1, -1)))

4235 def test_agm_simple():
4236     rtol = 1e-13
4237 
4238     # Gauss's constant
4239     assert_allclose(1/special.agm(1, np.sqrt(2)), 0.834626841674073186,
4240                     rtol=rtol)
4241 
4242     # These values were computed using Wolfram Alpha, with the
4243     # function ArithmeticGeometricMean[a, b].
4244     agm13 = 1.863616783244897
4245     agm15 = 2.604008190530940
4246     agm35 = 3.936235503649555
4247     assert_allclose(special.agm([[1], [3]], [1, 3, 5]),
4248                     [[1, agm13, agm15],
4249                      [agm13, 3, agm35]], rtol=rtol)
4250 
4251     # Computed by the iteration formula using mpmath,
4252     # with mpmath.mp.prec = 1000:
4253     agm12 = 1.4567910310469068
4254     assert_allclose(special.agm(1, 2), agm12, rtol=rtol)
4255     assert_allclose(special.agm(2, 1), agm12, rtol=rtol)
4256     assert_allclose(special.agm(-1, -2), -agm12, rtol=rtol)
4257     assert_allclose(special.agm(24, 6), 13.458171481725614, rtol=rtol)
4258     assert_allclose(special.agm(13, 123456789.5), 11111458.498599306,
4259                     rtol=rtol)
4260     assert_allclose(special.agm(1e30, 1), 2.229223055945383e+28, rtol=rtol)
4261     assert_allclose(special.agm(1e-22, 1), 0.030182566420169886, rtol=rtol)
4262     assert_allclose(special.agm(1e150, 1e180), 2.229223055945383e+178,
4263                     rtol=rtol)
4264     assert_allclose(special.agm(1e180, 1e-150), 2.0634722510162677e+177,
4265                     rtol=rtol)
4266     assert_allclose(special.agm(1e-150, 1e-170), 3.3112619670463756e-152,
4267                     rtol=rtol)
4268     fi = np.finfo(1.0)
4269     assert_allclose(special.agm(fi.tiny, fi.max), 1.9892072050015473e+305,
4270                     rtol=rtol)
4271     assert_allclose(special.agm(0.75*fi.max, fi.max), 1.564904312298045e+308,
4272                     rtol=rtol)
4273     assert_allclose(special.agm(fi.tiny, 3*fi.tiny), 4.1466849866735005e-308,
4274                     rtol=rtol)
4275 
4276     # zero, nan and inf cases.
4277     assert_equal(special.agm(0, 0), 0)
4278     assert_equal(special.agm(99, 0), 0)
4279 
4280     assert_equal(special.agm(-1, 10), np.nan)
4281     assert_equal(special.agm(0, np.inf), np.nan)
4282     assert_equal(special.agm(np.inf, 0), np.nan)
4283     assert_equal(special.agm(0, -np.inf), np.nan)
4284     assert_equal(special.agm(-np.inf, 0), np.nan)
4285     assert_equal(special.agm(np.inf, -np.inf), np.nan)
4286     assert_equal(special.agm(-np.inf, np.inf), np.nan)
4287     assert_equal(special.agm(1, np.nan), np.nan)
4288     assert_equal(special.agm(np.nan, -1), np.nan)
4289 
4290     assert_equal(special.agm(1, np.inf), np.inf)
4291     assert_equal(special.agm(np.inf, 1), np.inf)
4292     assert_equal(special.agm(-1, -np.inf), -np.inf)
4293     assert_equal(special.agm(-np.inf, -1), -np.inf)

4325 def test_xlogy():
4326     def xfunc(x, y):
4327         with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'):
4328             if x == 0 and not np.isnan(y):
4329                 return x
4330             else:
4331                 return x*np.log(y)
4332 
4333     z1 = np.asarray([(0,0), (0, np.nan), (0, np.inf), (1.0, 2.0)], dtype=float)
4334     z2 = np.r_[z1, [(0, 1j), (1, 1j)]]
4335 
4336     w1 = np.vectorize(xfunc)(z1[:,0], z1[:,1])
4337     assert_func_equal(special.xlogy, w1, z1, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)
4338     w2 = np.vectorize(xfunc)(z2[:,0], z2[:,1])
4339     assert_func_equal(special.xlogy, w2, z2, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)

4342 def test_xlog1py():
4343     def xfunc(x, y):
4344         with np.errstate(invalid='ignore'):
4345             if x == 0 and not np.isnan(y):
4346                 return x
4347             else:
4348                 return x * np.log1p(y)
4349 
4350     z1 = np.asarray([(0,0), (0, np.nan), (0, np.inf), (1.0, 2.0),
4351                      (1, 1e-30)], dtype=float)
4352     w1 = np.vectorize(xfunc)(z1[:,0], z1[:,1])

4356 def test_entr():
4357     def xfunc(x):
4358         if x < 0:
4359             return -np.inf
4360         else:
4361             return -special.xlogy(x, x)
4362     values = (0, 0.5, 1.0, np.inf)
4363     signs = [-1, 1]
4364     arr = []
4365     for sgn, v in itertools.product(signs, values):
4366         arr.append(sgn * v)
4367     z = np.array(arr, dtype=float)
4368     w = np.vectorize(xfunc, otypes=[np.float64])(z)
4369     assert_func_equal(special.entr, w, z, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)

4372 def test_kl_div():
4373     def xfunc(x, y):
4374         if x < 0 or y < 0 or (y == 0 and x != 0):
4375             # extension of natural domain to preserve convexity
4376             return np.inf
4377         elif np.isposinf(x) or np.isposinf(y):
4378             # limits within the natural domain
4379             return np.inf
4380         elif x == 0:
4381             return y
4382         else:
4383             return special.xlogy(x, x/y) - x + y
4384     values = (0, 0.5, 1.0)
4385     signs = [-1, 1]
4386     arr = []
4387     for sgna, va, sgnb, vb in itertools.product(signs, values, signs, values):
4388         arr.append((sgna*va, sgnb*vb))
4389     z = np.array(arr, dtype=float)
4390     w = np.vectorize(xfunc, otypes=[np.float64])(z[:,0], z[:,1])
4391     assert_func_equal(special.kl_div, w, z, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)
4392 
4393 
4394 def test_rel_entr():
4395     def xfunc(x, y):
4396         if x > 0 and y > 0:
4397             return special.xlogy(x, x/y)
4398         elif x == 0 and y >= 0:
4399             return 0
4400         else:
4401             return np.inf
4402     values = (0, 0.5, 1.0)
4403     signs = [-1, 1]
4404     arr = []
4405     for sgna, va, sgnb, vb in itertools.product(signs, values, signs, values):
4406         arr.append((sgna*va, sgnb*vb))
4407     z = np.array(arr, dtype=float)
4408     w = np.vectorize(xfunc, otypes=[np.float64])(z[:,0], z[:,1])
4409     assert_func_equal(special.rel_entr, w, z, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)

4431 def test_rel_entr_gh_20710_overflow():
4432     special.seterr(all='ignore')
4433     inputs = np.array([
4434         # x, y
4435         # Overflow
4436         (4, 2.22e-308),
4437         # Underflow
4438         (1e-200, 1e+200),
4439         # Subnormal
4440         (2.22e-308, 1e15),
4441     ])
4442     # Known values produced using `x * mpmath.log(x / y)` with dps=30
4443     expected = [
4444         2839.139983229607,
4445         -9.210340371976183e-198,
4446         -1.6493212008074475e-305,
4447     ]
4448     x = inputs[:, 0]
4449     y = inputs[:, 1]
4450     assert_allclose(special.rel_entr(x, y), expected, rtol=1e-13, atol=0)
4451 
4452 
4453 def test_huber():
4454     assert_equal(special.huber(-1, 1.5), np.inf)
4455     assert_allclose(special.huber(2, 1.5), 0.5 * np.square(1.5))
4456     assert_allclose(special.huber(2, 2.5), 2 * (2.5 - 0.5 * 2))
4457 
4458     def xfunc(delta, r):
4459         if delta < 0:
4460             return np.inf
4461         elif np.abs(r) < delta:
4462             return 0.5 * np.square(r)
4463         else:
4464             return delta * (np.abs(r) - 0.5 * delta)
4465 
4466     z = np.random.randn(10, 2)
4467     w = np.vectorize(xfunc, otypes=[np.float64])(z[:,0], z[:,1])
4468     assert_func_equal(special.huber, w, z, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)
4469 
4470 
4471 def test_pseudo_huber():
4472     def xfunc(delta, r):
4473         if delta < 0:
4474             return np.inf
4475         elif (not delta) or (not r):
4476             return 0
4477         else:
4478             return delta**2 * (np.sqrt(1 + (r/delta)**2) - 1)
4479 
4480     z = np.array(np.random.randn(10, 2).tolist() + [[0, 0.5], [0.5, 0]])
4481     w = np.vectorize(xfunc, otypes=[np.float64])(z[:,0], z[:,1])
4482     assert_func_equal(special.pseudo_huber, w, z, rtol=1e-13, atol=1e-13)
4483 
4484 
4485 def test_pseudo_huber_small_r():
4486     delta = 1.0
4487     r = 1e-18
4488     y = special.pseudo_huber(delta, r)
4489     # expected computed with mpmath:
4490     #     import mpmath
4491     #     mpmath.mp.dps = 200
4492     #     r = mpmath.mpf(1e-18)
4493     #     expected = float(mpmath.sqrt(1 + r**2) - 1)
4494     expected = 5.0000000000000005e-37
4495     assert_allclose(y, expected, rtol=1e-13)

4508 class TestStirling2:
4509     table = [
4510         [1],
4511         [0, 1],
4512         [0, 1, 1],
4513         [0, 1, 3, 1],
4514         [0, 1, 7, 6, 1],
4515         [0, 1, 15, 25, 10, 1],
4516         [0, 1, 31, 90, 65, 15, 1],
4517         [0, 1, 63, 301, 350, 140, 21, 1],
4518         [0, 1, 127, 966, 1701, 1050, 266, 28, 1],
4519         [0, 1, 255, 3025, 7770, 6951, 2646, 462, 36, 1],
4520         [0, 1, 511, 9330, 34105, 42525, 22827, 5880, 750, 45, 1],
4521     ]
4522 
4523     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4524         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4525         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-12})
4526     ])
4527     def test_table_cases(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4528         for n in range(1, len(self.table)):
4529             k_values = list(range(n+1))
4530             row = self.table[n]
4531             comp(row, stirling2([n], k_values, exact=is_exact), **kwargs)
4532 
4533     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4534         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4535         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-12})
4536     ])
4537     def test_valid_single_integer(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4538         comp(stirling2(0, 0, exact=is_exact), self.table[0][0], **kwargs)
4539         comp(stirling2(4, 2, exact=is_exact), self.table[4][2], **kwargs)
4540         # a single 2-tuple of integers as arguments must return an int and not
4541         # an array whereas arrays of single values should return array
4542         comp(stirling2(5, 3, exact=is_exact), 25, **kwargs)
4543         comp(stirling2([5], [3], exact=is_exact), [25], **kwargs)
4544 
4545     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4546         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4547         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-12})
4548     ])
4549     def test_negative_integer(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4550         # negative integers for n or k arguments return 0
4551         comp(stirling2(-1, -1, exact=is_exact), 0, **kwargs)
4552         comp(stirling2(-1, 2, exact=is_exact), 0, **kwargs)
4553         comp(stirling2(2, -1, exact=is_exact), 0, **kwargs)
4554 
4555     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4556         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4557         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-12})
4558     ])
4559     def test_array_inputs(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4560         ans = [self.table[10][3], self.table[10][4]]
4561         comp(stirling2(asarray([10, 10]),
4562                                asarray([3, 4]),
4563                                exact=is_exact),
4564                      ans)
4565         comp(stirling2([10, 10],
4566                                asarray([3, 4]),
4567                                exact=is_exact),
4568                      ans)
4569         comp(stirling2(asarray([10, 10]),
4570                                [3, 4],
4571                                exact=is_exact),
4572                      ans)
4573 
4574     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4575         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4576         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-13})
4577     ])
4578     def test_mixed_values(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4579         # negative values-of either n or k-should return 0 for the entry
4580         ans = [0, 1, 3, 25, 1050, 5880, 9330]
4581         n = [-1, 0, 3, 5, 8, 10, 10]
4582         k = [-2, 0, 2, 3, 5, 7, 3]
4583         comp(stirling2(n, k, exact=is_exact), ans, **kwargs)
4584 
4585     def test_correct_parity(self):
4586         """Test parity follows well known identity. 
4587  
4588         en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stirling_numbers_of_the_second_kind#Parity 
4589         """
4590         n, K = 100, np.arange(101)
4591         assert_equal(
4592             stirling2(n, K, exact=True) % 2,
4593             [math.comb(n - (k // 2) - 1, n - k) % 2 for k in K],
4594         )
4595 
4596     def test_big_numbers(self):
4597         # via mpmath (bigger than 32bit)
4598         ans = asarray([48063331393110, 48004081105038305])
4599         n = [25, 30]
4600         k = [17, 4]
4601         assert array_equal(stirling2(n, k, exact=True), ans)
4602         # bigger than 64 bit
4603         ans = asarray([2801934359500572414253157841233849412,
4604                        14245032222277144547280648984426251])
4605         n = [42, 43]
4606         k = [17, 23]
4607         assert array_equal(stirling2(n, k, exact=True), ans)

4609     @pytest.mark.parametrize("N", [4.5, 3., 4+1j, "12", np.nan])
4610     @pytest.mark.parametrize("K", [3.5, 3, "2", None])
4611     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact", [True, False])
4612     def test_unsupported_input_types(self, N, K, is_exact):
4613         # object, float, string, complex are not supported and raise TypeError
4614         with pytest.raises(TypeError):
4615             stirling2(N, K, exact=is_exact)
4616 
4617     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact", [True, False])
4618     def test_numpy_array_int_object_dtype(self, is_exact):
4619         # python integers with arbitrary precision are *not* allowed as
4620         # object type in numpy arrays are inconsistent from api perspective
4621         ans = asarray(self.table[4][1:])
4622         n = asarray([4, 4, 4, 4], dtype=object)
4623         k = asarray([1, 2, 3, 4], dtype=object)
4624         with pytest.raises(TypeError):
4625             array_equal(stirling2(n, k, exact=is_exact), ans)
4626 
4627     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4628         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4629         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-13})
4630     ])
4631     def test_numpy_array_unsigned_int_dtype(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4632         # numpy unsigned integers are allowed as dtype in numpy arrays
4633         ans = asarray(self.table[4][1:])
4634         n = asarray([4, 4, 4, 4], dtype=np_ulong)
4635         k = asarray([1, 2, 3, 4], dtype=np_ulong)
4636         comp(stirling2(n, k, exact=False), ans, **kwargs)
4637 
4638     @pytest.mark.parametrize("is_exact, comp, kwargs", [
4639         (True, assert_equal, {}),
4640         (False, assert_allclose, {'rtol': 1e-13})
4641     ])
4642     def test_broadcasting_arrays_correctly(self, is_exact, comp, kwargs):
4643         # broadcasting is handled by stirling2
4644         # test leading 1s are replicated
4645         ans = asarray([[1, 15, 25, 10], [1, 7, 6, 1]])  # shape (2,4)
4646         n = asarray([[5, 5, 5, 5], [4, 4, 4, 4]])  # shape (2,4)
4647         k = asarray([1, 2, 3, 4])  # shape (4,)
4648         comp(stirling2(n, k, exact=is_exact), ans, **kwargs)
4649         # test that dims both mismatch broadcast correctly (5,1) & (6,)
4650         n = asarray([[4], [4], [4], [4], [4]])
4651         k = asarray([0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5])
4652         ans = asarray([[0, 1, 7, 6, 1, 0] for _ in range(5)])
4653         comp(stirling2(n, k, exact=False), ans, **kwargs)
4654 
4655     def test_temme_rel_max_error(self):
4656         # python integers with arbitrary precision are *not* allowed as
4657         # object type in numpy arrays are inconsistent from api perspective
4658         x = list(range(51, 101, 5))
4659         for n in x:
4660             k_entries = list(range(1, n+1))
4661             denom = stirling2([n], k_entries, exact=True)
4662             num = denom - stirling2([n], k_entries, exact=False)
4663             assert np.max(np.abs(num / denom)) < 2e-5
